Reviews.Content: Received TV on 10/21/2013 about noon, set up, connected, operating fine at 5:30 PM.Early morning of 10/21/2013 TV would not turn on. Called Directv to make sure everything was alright on their end. No problem there. Called VIZIO got a young woman on the phone told her what the problem was. She put me through a work out of shutting it down, holding the off button etc. to no avail. She asked me for serial number. Gave her the number on the set and the box it came (both the same). She said no such number. I would have to take a picture and send it to her. Enough of her. ( Ah to be young again and not care about anyone but me) Went up the ladder to supervisor Steve, went through the process again with him, gave him the serial number, he told me he would order the parts, when they came in a repair person would call me and set up an appointment, also said it would take 5-6 business days. Does this sound like a common problem  now? Talk with a guy for about 4 minutes who is about 2,000 miles from me and he is going to order parts? Repair contractor called me on 11/01/2013 said they would be the ones to repair the TV when the parts came in and who the repair person  would be and they would call before coming.  Now it is 11/12/2013n nothing yet, still have a useless TV. Have had it for 23 days, it worked six. A bit past the 5-6 working days. Called repair contractor, lo and be hold they are sending repair person  tomorrow for repairs. Should have sent it back and replaced, would have been quicker. I think this will be 13 business days. Must be using the presidents math. Amazon has always been great to deal with so doubt if there would have been a problem  Advice for all.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: SCMama
Reviews.Content: We love Vizio TVs; we bought a 55" a couple of years ago when we moved into a bigger place. During our PCS, our bedroom TV was damaged, so we needed to replace it. Found this one and it fits perfectly above our fireplace. Picture is great, sound quality is good for the size of the TV and being able to connect to Netflix without having to use the PS3 or Wii has been much easier! We couldn't be happier with this TV!

Reviews.Title: Looks fine for the price but doesn't actually work that well...
Reviews.Author: Brilling
Reviews.Content: This TV gets very little use at the house. It is watched probably only 3 hours each week, so I was fairly frustrated when all the volume buttons stopped working just 6 months after purchase. You could still hear the volume but it was stuck at the last setting and it could not be adjusted up or down both via the TV remote and the actual hard buttons built into the TV. I called Vizio the first time and was told to do a hard reset where you unplug the TV and hold the power button for 30 seconds. That got the volume working again for all of 1 day before it stopped again.I just called Vizio again and I was told the volume doesn't work because something is trying to share files with the TV. What I needed to do was unplug my router, wireless adapter, turn off all 4 computers in the house, as well as all cell phones, tablets, etc.. and then turn them on 1 at a time to see which one is trying to share files with the TV. Once I figure that out, then I need to figure out how to turn off all the file sharing on that device. Allegedly, that will then make the volume on the TV work again.There is just one problem. That is completely insane!!!!! We are talking about turning up the volume on a TV that only gets a couple hours of use each week. I have to spend a couple hours unplugging all 11 internet devices we have to try to figure out which one is trying to share files with my TV just to make the volume work again? Really? Vizio can't figure out a software fix on their end? That is like having your coffee pot not work and someone telling you that you have to unscrew all the light bulbs in your house. It makes no sense whatsoever. Here's an idea Vizio. How about you just make your TV work? Until you figure that out, I will never buy another Vizio product and I will "dang" sure make sure everyone knows just how terrible a product Vizio makes.

Reviews.Title: love this tv
Reviews.Author: Beth Abbott
Reviews.Content: the only drawback is that it is tilted too far back, will definitely get a bracket to put on the wall.  Other than that it is easy to set up and love the picture and the remote is easy to work also.  I would highly recommend this TV

Reviews.Title: Nice picture but freezes up in WiFi! Problem may be across other models as well!
Reviews.Author: E L
Reviews.Content: When I initially bought my TV, the picture was great. However, I began to have problems with the TV where it would freeze up. After sending the TV back in and having the wireless card replaced, I found that the TV still has the same issue, freezing up to the point where you would have to turn the TV off and back on again. After multiple hours of time spent with customer support, I was told that there was an incompatibility issue with my wireless network such that it caused the TV to lock up. I was told that I would have to either disable my WiFi network (then what would deb the point of an internet TV) or disable the Network or File sharing function of my WiFi network. I was also told that it may have something to do with how the TV is not DLNA compatible. I have a standard out-of-the-box network from an Apple Airport Extreme, nothing fancy. I wouldn't know how to set up anything fancy with my network anyway. I spoke with Vizio by phone and email more times than I care to count. I was hoping to exchange my TV for a model that would not have the WiFi issues, but apparently I am told that all their TVs have the same WiFi card AND MAY BE SUBJECT TO HAVING THE SAME LOCKUP ISSUE! I was told that I am not alone in having this issue. So while having to deal with repeating the same story over three months to various support reps, getting the voicemail of a manager who takes over a week to return a voicemail, overall I have to rate the whole experience of owning a Vizio as abysmal. I'm still trying to troubleshoot the issue with a different manager, who has shot down my proposal to exchange my model for a newer one in the hopes that it resolves my WiFi issue. I guess, we'll just have to see...

Reviews.Title: Cheap and easy
Reviews.Author: Julie j Mayhew
Reviews.Content: Not the best TV ever, but it's been nice so far. The stand is really crappy, so you should intend to mount it. Seriously, the stand is THAT bad. The sound is nice and so is the picture. The only other real problem is that it takes forever for this to boot up and turn on.

Reviews.Title: Awful response time, the first Vizio I've bought that I don't love
Reviews.Author: Computer Repair Depot
Reviews.Content: I own 4 other "regular" Vizio TV's ranging from 32inch up to 47inch and I love all of them, have never had a single issue with them.However, this "smart" TV is absolutely horrible. For one thing it takes forever just to turn on, we're talking 20-30 seconds before it's ready to even display the TV or HDMI connection.The remote just feels laggy and there is a several second delay after pressing buttons.The "smart" aspect of these TV is atrocious, it has a terrible interface that is clunky and incredibly slow. I own Roku's and HTPC's and they run circles around this TV. In retrospect I should have just bought a regular Vizio TV and a Roku, but I thought this would be better...The internet connection is intermittent at best. There are times when I turn it on and none of the Apps can connect... Getting Netflix to work is a chore sometimes. This is never the case with my Rokus, you turn the TV on and boom it's already up and running.Stay away from this TV if you are looking for a good "regular" TV and if you're looking for a "smart" tv you should REALLY avoid this.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, great price
Reviews.Author: Denise Marie
Reviews.Content: This was my second Vizio smart TV. I bought this to replace a bedroom TV (not a Vizio; a Magnavox). The picture is great and it does a good job in automatically adjusting the aspect ratio for different channels. The sound is quite satisfactory for a small TV. The front-firing speakers clinched my decision (as they did on my slightly older Vizio). Most TVs today have rear-firing speakers (I suppose so the electronics companies can subsequently sell auxiliary speakers for $120 or more). Having speakers fire against the living room wall is just silly. The only thing I don't like is the stand, which is a simple lean-to. "Swivel" is unnecessary for such a lightweight TV, but "tilt" to change the viewing angle would have been good. Unfortunately, the old TV's stand would not work as it had a different VESA hole placement. I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a smaller TV - great price. Setting up the WiFi is a snap. Interesting to note that the Netflix interface on this TV is slightly different and a tad friendlier that the Netflix app on the slightly older Vizio. I use Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon.Edit on 3/6/14: I saw my review showed up for this TV in a listing by vendor One Stop Shop. I bought the TV from "Amazon.com LLC" with free prime shipping (and for 37 bucks less). I didn't buy from this vendor.

Reviews.Title: You better have a good and fast wireless signal
Reviews.Author: S. Marie "I'm the Decorator"
Reviews.Content: It wouldn't work in the room for which be bought it, because it couldn't pick up the wireless (the wireless was too weak and/or too slow, according to the customer service setup number that I called).  Very frustrating, particularly because other wireless devices work fine in that room.

Reviews.Title: TV crashes if it connects to the internet in certain circumstances
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "SK"
Reviews.Content: TV can freeze up when connecting to the internet in certain circumstances. I've bought 2 of this model.  What type of Smart TV can't connect to the internet.  I spoke with Vizio support, and this is a common issue, though unfortunately they weren't able to figure out why the TVs were freezing in my circumstance, even after being on the phone with them for hours.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Kumar "Kumar"
Reviews.Content: Few weeks back I bought a Samsung TV,which I had to return as it's turning itself off whenever I increase or decrease the volume.Later, I bought VIZIO E500i-A1 50inch TV, and totally surprised how excellent the picture quality is for almost $300 cheaper than Samsung model that I've returned.None of the default settings of this TV are good. Used Disney WOW to calibrate and a lot of trial and errors and finally came up with the following settings and hope it'll help people who want to do the settings.Picture Mode :CalibratedBacklight : 45Brightnesss : 52Contrast : 45Color : 40Tint : -2Sharpness : 0Color Temperature : CustomRed Gain : 100Green Gain : 105Blue Gain : 110Red Offset :128Green Offset : 128Blue Offset :128Advanced Picture:Auto brightness control : OffBlack detail : MediumSmart dimming : OnReduce signal noise : OffReduce block noise : LowFilm mode : Auto.

Reviews.Title: This is a great TV and worth the money.
Reviews.Author: Donald Shipman
Reviews.Content: If you decide to purchase the additional warranty and you have a Costco card, buy the warranty from Costco and save a good amount.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: amy meixner
Reviews.Content: This TV is nice and big and it has amazing quality and I love the smart feature about it! Its awesome!

Reviews.Title: VIZIO 32" TV
Reviews.Author: Robert T. Hawkins
Reviews.Content: I really like this TV.  Very light and easy to set up.  Smart features (e.g. Netflix and Amazon) built in, are really handy and seem to work well, using the remote.  Excellent value for the price.  Picture qualify is outstanding.  Sound is "weak".  Added a refurbished VIZIO sound bar for about $40, which vastly improves the sound.  Overall, still an excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: Poor WiFi Reception Made for Frustrating Experience
Reviews.Author: An Average Joe
Reviews.Content: I put this 24" smart TV exactly where a Roku 2 worked perfectly before.  This TV would not work acceptably until I bought a WiFi extender.  I ended up just running ethernet between the WiFi extender and the TV to eliminate using the WiFi in the TV at all.  Software is not as fast or as polished as the Roku and it doesn't recover from errors and interruptions as gracefully.  As a longtime Roku and PS3 streamer this is a sub-par experience.  I bought it to save wires and clutter but the need to add a WiFi extender negated that.  Would not buy again.

Reviews.Title: Information pane needs improvement
Reviews.Author: RV guy
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture and features it just has the same problem that all Vizio tv's have. The information window is too small and does not contain information for the next program. If you using a cable box than this doesn't matter if your viewing off air signals it makes a big difference. It doesn't matter if you have 19 inch or a 60 it's the same small window. Samsung has a much better info window containing the next program information and you can read it across the room.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: Brianna Scheper
Reviews.Content: It was in great condition and I love how easy it is to use the apps. Definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Watch out when buying from Amazon!!!
Reviews.Author: Reynold D.
Reviews.Content: stopped working in about 2 months and Visio said they would not honor the warranty because Amazon provided a third party seller who was not authorized by Visio.  I had an extended warranty(Square Trade) or I would have been out $200.00

Reviews.Title: GOOD DEAL
Reviews.Author: Mr Mike
Reviews.Content: Have had this TV 3 weeks now.  It updated itself via WIFI the first night.  Has good sound and picture at a great price, I'm very happy.

Reviews.Title: Vizio
Reviews.Author: Chels
Reviews.Content: Shipping arrived sooner then disclosed.  It was easy to unwrap and set up (linked WiFi with no hassle and then set up my amazon and Netflix accounts).  I think the picture and sound is great and it's easy to access WiFi accounts. Good quality at a good price!

Reviews.Title: VIZEO39" Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Jenny Kack "Jenny Kack"
Reviews.Content: I chose this VIZIO brand tv because the VIZIO I had previously worked so well UNTIL we had a direct lightening hit that burned much more than the tv.  I particularly like the "smart tv" feature which is so much more convenient that the previous tv which required a blue ray  player.  Fine tv w/excellent picture.

Reviews.Title: Love the VIZIO
Reviews.Author: Linda Reimer
Reviews.Content: Quality of picture is excellent, user friendly to install and program, price was right, received the next day from Amazon after ordering on line. This is our second Vizio television and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Worked Great Until It Broke; But The Replacement Works Well So Far
Reviews.Author: Buddy S
Reviews.Content: I use this TV about 30-60 minutes four or five times a week in an exercise room and, after a little more than three weeks of use, the TV just completely quit receiving over the air (OTA) reception with an indoor antenna.  Until this problem occurred, the TV reception was outstanding, pulling in about 20 local channels, of which seven were in crystal clear high definition.  The TV also produced very good video from an up converting DVD player connected through the HDMI input.  Setting up the wireless function was quick and easy and I enjoyed listening to music through Pandora.Putting aside the catastrophic failure of the OTA TV reception, my only complaint with this TV lies with the small built-in speakers - the audio sounds tinny and anemic.  This, however, is not a major issue for me since I have a small home theater system connected to the TV through the TV's headphone jack.  The TV also has a digital optical output jack, but my inexpensive home theater receiver lacks a digital audio input, so I get stereo audio from the TV through the left and right front speakers in the home theater systemWhen I encountered the problem with no TV reception, I immediately called Amazon's technical support.  The tech rep suggested several possible fixes, most of which I had already tried and when it became obvious that there was a major problem that could not be resolved over the telephone, the tech rep arranged for a free exchange for a new TV.  Fortunately, I was still within Amazon's 30 day return period on my original purchase.  I just received the new TV today and it is working properly.  I will supplement this report as I get further use with the replacement.This 24 inch Smart HD TV offers a lot of bang for the buck and I am hoping the replacement unit, unlike the original, gives me many years of use.  If you purchase this TV, or for that matter any other electronic product, from Amazon, my suggestion is that you give it a heavy workout during the first 30 days.  If a defect shows up, you can then get it resolved with a minimum of expense and inconvenience during Amazon's 30 day return period.

Reviews.Title: It rawks!!
Reviews.Author: Mud Dauber
Reviews.Content: Works well, very well, in fact. Minus one star for tiny non-illuminated remote buttons. You'll need audio equipment. Speakers are for appearance only.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: mikaela robinson
Reviews.Content: I like this tv. It's a little slow scrolling around the apps and netflix but it's definitely tolerable. Its a great tv for the price.

Reviews.Title: Filled the need beautifully.
Reviews.Author: Darrick Webster
Reviews.Content: Bought this for the kids room.  They love both netflix and Amazon Prime, and having a button for each right there on the remote makes usage trivial; simpler than having to switch to Roku, for example.It connected to my wireless network without issue.  I can't say the same for my much more expensive Toshiba-branded TV, so bonus to Vizio for this.While this is perfect for a smaller room/kids room, it is not something that I would purchase for a larger room/living room because of the small size.  Note that this is my 2nd Vizio and I honestly don't have anything negative to say about either unit.  Both work well.  Good price, quality product.

Reviews.Title: Make Every Seat in the House the Best Seat in the House
Reviews.Author: Othello Lofton
Reviews.Content: This is our first HDTV. Our old SD CRT set is finally going to that great Living Room in the sky. The television arrived and I watched in horror as UPS tumbled the box out of the truck. The television box was safely in nestled in at least seven pounds of packing material and a larger, thicker card board box. Thank goodness for good packaging.We unpacked the television and everything worked right out of the box. It was easy to connect to Netflix and Amazon. The kids even prefer to use Netflix on the television as opposed to the Xbox360.I've noticed no lag and very few artifacts while watching football or playing video games. The picture is always bright and clear with very good color reproduction in a room with two large windows next to the TV. I have noticed a slight dimming and color washing when viewing off angle but it's much less than I expected.

Reviews.Title: It's good
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Wish it had more apps, but otherwise is great. It's lightweight and easy to move around. Color is great, sound good.

Reviews.Title: Great value, sharp picture
Reviews.Author: Vincenzo "Vance"
Reviews.Content: "Needed" a TV for my bedroom and decided that I wanted to get a Vizio because of my previous experience with them.  I am impressed by how clear, bright and vivid the picture is and its very smooth.  I love the SMART options and it streams Netflix and Hulu perfectly. Definitely a winner in my book.

Reviews.Title: Good Purchase.
Reviews.Author: bober bill
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new Vizio TV.  I already have a larger one in my living room and liked it so well I got one for the bedroom. The picture quality is very clear and the speakers make clear sounds so I don't think I'm going deaf. Highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great T.V.
Reviews.Author: redhead
Reviews.Content: I really like our new T.V.-we had an ancient TV/VCR combo-now I can watch Hulu and Netflix on my T.V. directly and it's very nice.  Very clear picture-can be very loud on the volume-great bedroom TV for us.  I'm very happy with it so far.  It's very user friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: mrsmaonaigh
Reviews.Content: We got this tv solely for the purpose of streaming Netflix in our bedroom.  However, the tv has major issues connecting to Netflix.  It either lags several times during one show, causing major interruptions or it doesn't connect at all.  We've contacted Vizio and got the standard "do a factory reset" which did nothing but make it even worse.  It does have a nice picture when it is working.  This is very disappointing because we own several other Vizio products and have loved them.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Paladorys
Reviews.Content: It doesn't have every bell and whistle, and since its a smart TV there is some additional setup besides plugging it in and turning it on, like connecting it to your network. Naming your inputs, adjusting the settings for each input so they are where you like them for each connected device. Setting up and updating the apps. I was disappointed that there were 2 updates, and that all my app settings were reset after I thought I was done, but after the 2nd update no more problems.

Reviews.Title: Sharp picture
Reviews.Author: KaiserKat
Reviews.Content: We bought this tv for our bedroom and it's working out great.  It's the right size and the clarity is super!  We like we can get netflicks and all the functions are on the remote.  The best buy for our money!

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: atropos
Reviews.Content: Got this TV as a gift to my husband and he loves it. Easy to set up, easy to work with. I love that we have access to all of our subscriptions at the same time. I think that Amazon can work on making their app for smart TVs better.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: My first TV I bought or have had in 6 years. Best decision I have made in a product! My Dog even watches the tv!

Reviews.Title: Great buy great picture
Reviews.Author: Jennifer stands
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the tv and the wireless capabilities are awesome.  We would recommend this tv to anyone who is looking for a smart tv.  Price was better than any store we could find.  We were a little worried about having it shipped but it was packaged very nicely and ups did a great job handling it.

Reviews.Title: Vizio tv
Reviews.Author: Judy Penick
Reviews.Content: Slow coming on. Visio remote hard to understand. Cannot find apps on remote.  TV ok but disappointed in complexity of remote.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, Terrible apps
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV so I could watch Amazon Prime movies and Youtube videos on TV. The audio and 1080p, 120 Hz picture is great, but the built-in apps are terrible. Youtube only shows a few results when you search for videos that return hundreds of results on my laptop, and the TV doesn't buffer videos as well as the computer. The Amazon app looks and acts like something out of the 1980's. I find myself searching for a movie on the computer and then having to type in the name of the movie on the Amazon app using the 1980's TV remote just to get it to play on the TV. The remote was terribly designed and the buttons are microscopic. I find that it is easier to hook the laptop up to the TV using an HDMI cable and just typing/searching on the computer. Now that I think about it, maybe three stars was too many...

Reviews.Title: 32'' TV
Reviews.Author: Tamara Hillman
Reviews.Content: We ordered this 32" TV for our screened-in Arizona room.Living here,(in Arizona) it has to be heat-resistant to survive our summers,so we'll see how it does, but it is mounted on the house wall which will always be shadedinside the enclosed patio.Works great so far, and is the perfect size.

Reviews.Title: Great tv, great picture
Reviews.Author: ernest g ruiz
Reviews.Content: This tv really surprised me with it's inky black levels and fantastic contrast and color.The smart features are excellent but viewing angles are fair.This is a great buy, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: sasha
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this deal.  We've had a little trouble getting it dialed in as far as sound & picture, but that is probably operator inexperience more than anything.  It has a very crisp picture and we love the fact that there is little frame - all picture.

Reviews.Title: I loved my shipment of my Vizio TV sent through Amazon.com
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "James T Simbeck"
Reviews.Content: I trust Vizio products and this order I made through Amazon.com met all of my personal standards. The box came to me a little damaged but with the packaging the TV was in excellent condition TY very much for your company

Reviews.Title: Well I wouldn't call it a "smart" tv
Reviews.Author: Cicely "dinocat"
Reviews.Content: This TV is ok if you only want to watch from your cable, if however, like me, you want to watch netflix and other apps, you can forget it. It connected once, but it hasn't since then. It says there is only one wifi bar signal, but I get full strength with my laptop, phone, and ipad in the same location.In addition to the lousy wifi connection, there is a really weird feature that makes the sound come in waves--I finally figured out that you have to turn this "feature" off in the settings.Also, I wish the remote lit up. And the power button on the remote is so small it's hard to locate.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews here and bought it at Walmart. It was the same cost either way and I was able to see it in action on display there so.....But anyway, I have the 50". Great price for a LED smart tv.  Picture is excellent. I adjusted the picture settings from factory as it was too red, now more realistic colors.Setup was extremely simple. It located my Wi-Fi in about 3 seconds and hasn't cut out yet (1 week in).Only gave it 4 out of 5 stars as there were some downside.There is a glare from windows. Doesn't matter if sun is shining or cloudy. Not terrible. Snow outside makes a brighter glare..It does come with the Amazon streaming app installed even with an amazon button on the remote, but it is glitchy. Sometimes it doesn't work right, freezes, etc. Once a video was streaming, it doesn't have any problems. but exit out early and thats when hiccups occur.I mounted it on the wall and cannot seem to find a flat plate for the bottom to cover the stand port. so I just left it open for now.All in all, I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Crappy wireless connection
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "schupe7"
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for the last 4 days and it has not stayed connected to the internet consistently. There is nothing wrong with my wireless network. My other devices work just fine. I purchased this tv specifically to use the Amazon Instant video app and it sucks. It won't connect and on the few instances that it did connect, the connection was intermittent or just dropped completely. When it was connected to the internet Netflix worked fine, but Amazon did not. If I do not get sufficient customer support it's going back.Update: I went as far as purchasing a new router thinking that maybe that would help resolve the issue with the tv not connecting to the internet wirelessly. However, no such luck. It connected once and we were able to watch a couple of shows on Amazon, but then the signal was lost to never be found again. I even restored back to the manufacturer settings TWICE and no such luck. So the tv is on it's way back to Amazon. Hopefully the Samsung I've purchased will prove to be better.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: Michael T Pulos Sr
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for my grand-daughter and she is very pleased.  No effort to set up and attached to cable.  She loves it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect wifi tv!
Reviews.Author: lizzy
Reviews.Content: I love my TV! I've now had it 10 months and have had no issues. The picture is perfect! I researched the hell out of wifi TV's and knew that Vizio had a very good reputation. Couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Whoever designed that stand should be flogged.
Reviews.Author: P. Johnson "Savannah J"
Reviews.Content: I'm not normally a fan of public flogging, but that stand is horrid. Whoever is responsible for that should be stopped before he/she designs again.

Reviews.Title: matches with the Vizio 40 inch Sound bar
Reviews.Author: clark foster johnson
Reviews.Content: Great combination for a guest room.  Very little space used and great picture and sound... 1st class combo.  Got them from the vizio outlet. Great value.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with it
Reviews.Author: J. L. McKinley ""I even read cereal boxes...
Reviews.Content: After several false starts getting another brand of "smart" TV only to be totaly disappointed, this Vizio is everything I wanted.  Just great.  Good picture, simple menu commands ... even a nontech person such as myself can understand it.

Reviews.Title: VIZUO TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: So far I like the tv & size & HD.  It is a smart tv but have not used that much yet. So far so good.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV, HD TV, What More Can You Want?
Reviews.Author: Marc Schiler "Curious Professor"
Reviews.Content: This TV has all of the normal qualifications, such as high definition, outstanding color, a half dozen inputs and does double duty as a computer monitor.  But it is also already a WiFi station with preprogrammed hulu and Netflix access, so you can watch from anywhere in the house, if you have WiFi available.  No wires, just the power plug.  Lovely!

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Neloff
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my kid. Works great. Love the quick access buttons on the remote. If it was 1080p i would've given it 5 stars

Reviews.Title: A smart TV at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Brett M
Reviews.Content: I bought my first VIZIO tv almost 5 years ago. It was a 37'' LCD. We recently bought a house and the apartment sized 37" just wasn't cutting it. I made my buying decision on the great success I had with the old VIZIO. This review is for the 50".The Good:Smart TV features are simple yet entertaining.After some adjustment, the picture is beautiful.The thin bezel makes this TV look very sleek.Both WiFi and ethernet streaming is fast.American made.Cons:Because the TV back lit, it is not as thin as edge lit LED TVs.Sound lacks. You will want a sound bar or other speakers.No Quarty keypad on remote makes initial set up a hassle.Dark spots in corners from weight of TV. (I will be contacting them to see if this is normal)The Ending Sentence:Vizio makes a great American made TV at a price lower than most.

Reviews.Title: How is this TV so cheap?
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: Technology is getting so amazing.  I can't believe the quality of this TV for the price.  I upgraded my bedroom TV and the smart TV was huge for Netflix and Amazon Prime.The TV is light, slick looking and the picture is amazing.  I have nothing negative.  The sound is ok, but what kind of speakers can you fit in a flat screen?It's a no brainer.  Great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Plugged it in and watched it Work
Reviews.Author: Edward W Nesoff
Reviews.Content: I do not normally take the time to do ratings, but this one is worth the time.  This TV exceeded my expectations despite some of the negative reviews.  It worked right out of the box.  I did not have to mess with settings or anything.  Also, this TV was purchased through Amazon and was shipped in perfect condition, and it arrived in only 2 days to Honolulu!!!

Reviews.Title: Very nice tv for the price.
Reviews.Author: BJW
Reviews.Content: I had been considering upgrading my old 36" tube TV to my first HDTV for a couple of years now and had narrowed it down between a Samsung and Vizio, Samsung didn't have the 42" size I determined I needed and there closest model was more expensive so I went with this 42" Vizio. This TV has a impressive picture, especially when you hook it up using the HDMI cable for max resolution and calrity. Component cable is not that bad looking, if that is all you have and don't want to buy additional cables, but would recommend the HDMI cable. Wasn't expecting the built in speakers to have nice sound but it does, it has different modes(rock, jazz, classical like on a stereo or ipod, it even has a sound equalizer. This TV has a lot of features and several picture and sound modes, but the picture has a custom mode if you don't want to use any of the predetermine modes you can adjust the TV manually.Amazon shipped this out quick and arrived, it good condition ordered it on a Saturday night it came on Tuesday.I was concerned before receiving this because I didn't get the Samsung and Vizio is the lesser manufacturer, but heard some good things about Vizio in the past, so this also helped my final decision I am so glad I did I am very happy with it so far. I haven't use the smart features yet, like the ethernet or the wifi yet as I had the TV just a short time. But will update my review once I do.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV except for the stand.
Reviews.Author: B. Kirkorian "History buff"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for one of the bedrooms. Considering the small size, the features, price, and picture and sound quality are excellent. My wireless N router is located about 15 feet away from the TV in another room, but the wireless strength is excellent. No issues streaming Netflix, Vudu, or the other sites.Unlike most small flat screen TVs with a tilting stand, this particular model comes with a fixed angle table top stand, in which the best viewing quality will be if the TV height is lower than eye level. In my case, I initially set the TV on top of a 5 ft tall chest of drawers to be viewed in essentially a prone position below the TV. Needless to say, the picture quality as a result of this viewing angle was poor. I resolved this issue by replacing the supplied fixed table mount with a tilt/swivel wall mount, and mounting the TV to the wall. I now have the perfect viewing angle and the picture is great.Now if the TV manufacturer's could only include a snore detector that would turn the TV off automatically...

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Eric O
Reviews.Content: Really appreciate this TV, it has an excellent picture, good quality, the price point was excellent for a Smart HDTV. Don't use the smart functions as much as I thought, but nice to have them available.

Reviews.Title: Size matters - in sound quality
Reviews.Author: Tastinient
Reviews.Content: I recently rated the 24" model of this series. I rated the TV 3 stars because of the low quality 2 watt speakers. What is the point of high definition, and streaming audio and video, if the sound is just bad? I also think the tilted base is odd and limiting for many people.But it's better news for this size. Happily, the 29" model comes with 5 watt speakers, and while it's not exactly a theater experience, the sound is adequate and improved in comparison to the 24".This set is otherwise impressive for the price. It starts up quickly, gets a strong signal from my router, and has an impressive amount of apps. It's light, the picture is crisp, in short it checks nearly every box you want for a web enabled TV. The tilted base on this series remains strange, and because the set has limited viewing angles, it's a problem for many, so I give it 4 rather than 5 stars. I have mounted mine to the wall, so the base is not an issue, and I'm completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Comprehensive Smart, But
Reviews.Author: Randall Griffin
Reviews.Content: Pros:Video - good not crisp.  cropping or zoom may be required.  8 of 10Audio - fine.  8 of 10Smart - Netflix and media library and othersCons:Media app doesn't have current video and audio codecs and no updates are possible or available (per their helpdesk)Media app response time and display fair.  Took minutes to display folder contents and then only a few ~15 per pageStuck.  Device froze a couple of times (grey screen of death).  Had to unplug to reset.  (Not good during the first week.)Conclusion:It is going back.  I will spend $50 more to get better video and access to my media library (perhaps Samsung UN32EH5300)

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: jl
Reviews.Content: Great deal for the money. The quality of the image is better than anticipated. Lots of great features on top of that.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Renee Ann Hermiz
Reviews.Content: This item arrived within a day or two -- so quickly.  I bought it new, but want to make clear that it was in perfect condition.  So first, bravo for the packaging and shipping.  The product itself ... well, I can't believe how amazing it is.  The TV is easy to use ... the set up was simple.  I bought a Blue Ray player to go with it and am so happy.  I'm still stunned at how little it cost for what it can do:  go online ... watch netflix ... beautiful picture image ... etc.  I bought it with the black surrounding trim.  Some users have said it takes a little long to turn on -- eh!!!  There's a bit of a moment you wait once you press the "on" button, but I so don't care ... quite a petty thing compared to the package itself.  EXCELLENT BUY!

Reviews.Title: Fine TV
Reviews.Author: Susan Bonello
Reviews.Content: This is my first experience with HDTV & I'm sorry I waited so long.  The picture is very bright ( checked it before I bought at a big box store).  I've only had it slightly over a month so do not know how reliable it will be.  Quite happy so far.  It's a 40" not a 47" though.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price - plus we ditched cable
Reviews.Author: christina
Reviews.Content: When our old TV died, we started doing research on what to get, and read reviews here on Amazon, and CNET, etc.  This TV got great reviews everywhere and so we went for it (even tho we had never heard of this brand).So besides being a space-saving flat screen, and having a great HD picture, the best part of having this new TV is that we no longer have cable!  Instead, since this is a "smart TV" -- we have our internet plugged in directly to the TV, and since the TV comes with NetFlix, Hulu and Amazon Prime (and many more) "pre-loaded" - it's super fast and easy to stream from the internet.So far we're loving the TV and not having to pay a cable bill.  Highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Love this product, did not come with the keyboard remote.
Reviews.Author: Naturegirl "Naturegirl"
Reviews.Content: I had to plug in the computer keyboard to enter in the wireless stuff because the remote has no keyboard. But the sound and picture quality is excellent. Especially considering the 24 inch only takes 5 dollars a year to operate. It was really easy to set up Netflix and Amazon Instant. I would recommend this tv to those people who do not have a xbox to connect netflix with.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: John Schaefer
Reviews.Content: Good on-axis image. Not so good off-axis by more than maybe twenty degrees.The mounting point pattern was not fully consistent with the standard wall mount I bought. I made it work, but I was surprised by the existence of the issue. Probably my fault for not checking the specs well enough, but why would mounting points be non-standard?

Reviews.Title: After 3 months I still love it
Reviews.Author: D. Barnes
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't already been said? This is a fabulous TV at a great price. I bought the 39-inch model because my living room is tiny, and it's just about the perfect size for my viewing distance. The built-in apps are all you really need but you can add and delete apps (yes, it's actually possible to delete the useless Yahoo apps). You do have to sign up for the Yahoo app store but that's painless. I had no trouble at all getting the TV to recognize my WiFi network, and connecting it to Netflix and Amazon Prime couldn't be easier.The slim-bezel design ensures that none of the picture gets cut off. Of the brands I shopped before buying this TV and experience with friends' TVs, Vizio and Samsung seem to be the best at not chopping the bottom of the screen off. Panasonic and LG cut off a significant portion of the picture on all sides, and Magnavox cuts off quite a bit too.TV reception is solid, the tuner has all the latest DTV technology and it has no trouble with my indoor antenna. Fast-motion shots in football games can be problematic if your local station has any sub-channels eating up their bandwidth but as long as the source signal isn't compressed too much you won't notice any artifacts. Picture quality is incredibly sharp and the built-in speakers are all most people will ever need but it does support external audio devices if you are a surround-sound aficionado.The coolest thing about the Amazon Prime app is that while you're searching on the left side of the screen for the video you want to watch, the live TV picture scales down to the remaining 75% of the screen on the right so you can browse for the latest Downton Abbey episodes while your local meteorologist talks about the weather. Of the video-streaming apps on this TV, the Amazon Prime app is the best.Netflix comes in a close second. Navigation is easy and video quality is second to none, as long as the video is available for 720p or 1080p. Some TV shows that were produced in HD are only available on NF in 480p resolution, but the TV handles those well. I was actually surprised when I was watching a David Tennant-era Doctor Who episode and the TV reported that it was only receiving a 480p stream from NF.The YouTube app is kind of clunky but when it's playing videos it plays them back without any problems, and you can sign in to your YouTube account so you can use the website to find videos and put them in your Watch Later list, then get to them from the TV without having to deal with the app's search function.The only app I was disappointed with was Hulu Plus. The video was washed out, and the sound was tinny. I hooked up the Xbox and played the same video using that Hulu app and the video and sound quality were great, so this is a fault with the Hulu Plus app for Vizio. I contacted Hulu support and they were not helpful. Most of what I wanted to watch they still don't have rights to stream to TV or mobile devices so I canceled my free trial anyway. Therefore the Hulu app's shortcomings are a non-issue for me. If you want to use Hulu and have a game console or other streaming device, use that for Hulu, not the TV's Hulu app.The media player app can stream videos, music and photos from your PC running media-streaming software such as TVersity. Combined with Windows Media Center (free) and a TV tuner card, I've made this my DVR.This is by far the best TV I have ever owned. I'm planning to buy a smaller version for the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Larry Wishon
Reviews.Content: What an amazing deal I recieved n with a great quality to match. This will be a great addition to our home entertainment.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV; WiFi adapter is worthless
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews but felt I had to write so that people will know that if they intend to use this TV for its Smart TV apps (Netflix, Amazon, Hulu Plus, YouTube, etc) via WiFi, you will be sorely disappointed. I have yet to try a wired connection, but the built-in WiFi adapter for this TV is terrible. My Nexus 7, iPhone, and laptop all get good reception using the same streaming apps from the same spot, but the Vizio TV either cannot connect or the connections constantly drop out. So unless you are intending to use this with only with a set-top box and/or a wire Ethernet connection, I'd say look for another solution. My way around this problem was to buy a Google Chromecast.That said, the TV is otherwise a decent, low-end TV. The picture is good, the connections are adequate (only 1x HDMI), and setup was simple.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E390i-A1 39-Inch 1080p 120Hz Smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: KellyB
Reviews.Content: Including the tv I have since the reviews seem to include all the eSeries Vizios, regardless of size.I've had this tv for a couple weeks and love it for the most part.  This is my first LED or HDTV as my previous tv came over on the Mayflower.  :)Plusses:Netflix and Amazon Prime Streaming are great.  I've also used an HDMI cable to hook my laptop up to it to watch other video, which works well once it's set up.It has a great pictures, after adjustments as described below.Original setup was painless.Minuses:The remote--Would be better if lit.  It could also be easier to read and would be nice if it included a keyboard.When watching streaming (Amazon/Netflix/etc), I can't get it to stay at 1080i or other picture settings to stay without resetting it every time I turn the tv on.  I use the "Reset Picture Mode" to get to 1080i, and then go in and turn off the Smart Dimming.  It's ok when it's the DVR, so I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong there. It would be nice if those settings would stick.

Reviews.Title: One really good value!
Reviews.Author: Lawrence
Reviews.Content: You don't know how much of a picture you are missing till you see it on this TV! At 60Hz there are things that you never see. Watch football on this one!

Reviews.Title: No online content without remote control.
Reviews.Author: 0xDEADBEEF
Reviews.Content: Great for the price if you can live with the following:No extended functions without remote control: no netflix, amazon, dlna, youtube, etc. You can not access any of these things without the remote control.The wifi performance is weak. I have other devices that work fine in the same room, and area (router is downstairs about 30 feet away). It works, but sometimes it just flakes out.The DLNA streaming performance is worthless. Does not support mkv or any format other than mp4 and then only at the low standard. Sometimes it will list the movie on my server, but refuse to play it.

Reviews.Title: Not happy with the product
Reviews.Author: Lovin' life in Florida
Reviews.Content: Not happy with the product.  Have had a very difficult time adjusting the color balance.  Colors in the shadows go very dark too easily and if I adjust to brighten up the shadows, it blows out the brighter colors.  Also struggling to get the tints just right.  Looked at other reviews for clues on settings, but it seems other Vizio products use different scales on color settings, so not much help.  Did not have the same problem with a Samsung product.I assumed due to weak audio, I would hook up a PC speaker set to the TV to enhance the audio. First TV had no earphone jack signal output.  It was easily and quickly replaced by Vizio (Kudos to Vizio).  Replacement TV earphone jack output signal was very weak.  Had to crank up to 90% to get low to average sound output on either earphones or the PC speaker set.  [Earphones and speakers worked fine on my PC at 20-25% volume setting]  Spoke to Vizio Customer Service and was told (1) earphone jack was not for that purpose(??); (2) Earphone jack was not  an "amplified" output (true, but it should provide a variable level signal to drive the earphones); (3) it was a constant volume output (not true; varying the volume level would vary the output) and they couldn't help me further.

Reviews.Title: Love the Smart TV Functionality
Reviews.Author: Robert Harris
Reviews.Content: Let's face it...it's great to have the wireless device inside the TV instead of a separate wireless receiver and related extra remote.  The picture quality is quite good but not quite as sharp as my existing Samsung Flat Screen TVs.  I had to avoid Samsung since it didn't come with the Smart TV feature in a 29 inch TV.  Another "stand out" feature is the sub-woofer and great speakers...what a super sound out of a 29 inch frame!!!  The price is also very low for all the features that you get.  I'd buy it again without any hesitation.....

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Helen R "Helen R"
Reviews.Content: I love this smart tv and have had no problems with it at all. I would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Great quaility
Reviews.Author: Gary Chatham
Reviews.Content: Great Picture , Easy to use and the Smart part of this Flat Screen takes you to another Level of Electronic Devices.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV, very good value
Reviews.Author: EMTP EJ "EJ"
Reviews.Content: This TV has 4 HDMI ports,one component (shared with the composite input)Digital TV / TV coax - either cable or antenna1 USBEthernet or wifias well as L & R RCA audio out and optical audio out.The remote uses a 4-way pointer, like you would see on a cellphone or other device, in addition to the usual remote control buttons.Since it is a smart TV, it can use on-board apps.It also has the standard VESA mounting system.

Reviews.Title: Fantasic TV & monitor
Reviews.Author: A. Dightam
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV.I use just about every option available. I have my Google Chromebox in one HDMI and use the Vizio as a monitor for several hours a day for work. I have my Windows 7 PC in the other HDMI input and can use the DVD player on the PC to play movies over the Vizio, or stream anything I want. I also have an antenna for my over-the-air TV reception. I've run a movie in the USB slot off a 4GB thumb drive. Everything works really well.HDTV via my indoor antenna is excellent. I live in a city in a valley with TV towers 7-miles from my house. The picture is crisp (sometimes breathtaking depending on the program source).720 & 60 is just fine for a 32" screen. I was watching Braquo on Hulu the other day and could see the finest detail on one of the female character's colorful costume - it wouldn't have been any better with 1080 & 120. Refresh is good enough; I get some artifacts on over the air progs with fast moving content but kind of expect it with a TV that costs less than 300-bucks.The apps are great - I use Netflix (excellent), Amazon Prime (excellent), Hulu (excellent), YouTube (very good), Pandora (vg), Tune-in (buggy - some stations don't work), IHeartRadio (same as Tune-in - buggy). Warning to all: don't install the Weather4us app unless you want a constant siren alert when your area has a weather emergency (like a flash flood warning). The alert also takes over the Vizio completely shutting down all operations. Obviously, I uninstalled it.I wired in my internet in which is recommended. The wifi works fine but I get much faster speed over Ethernet which is better for Amazon, Hulu, Netflix, etc.Highly recommended. Go get yourself one.

Reviews.Title: Younger generation "Know How"
Reviews.Author: Satisfied
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to discover how light weight the unit was.  It came much sooner than was predicted. I was unable to sync it with my cable provider . I am so not techy. My son and daughter came over one evening and set it all up for me.  Can fully enjoy it now. It was a good purchase experience.

Reviews.Title: Good as a smart tv, not as a PC display
Reviews.Author: Abraham
Reviews.Content: I hoped this would be good as a pc display and tv, but was not fast enough as a pc display. Returned it.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 47" LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Rico
Reviews.Content: As advertised.  Great quality and functionality.  Wish it had more component/HDMI plug-ins, but for the price, I can't complain.  As advertised.

Reviews.Title: Great selection of TV
Reviews.Author: Kenan J. Kern
Reviews.Content: A superior TV with all the bells and whistles.  I would recommend this television to anyone looking to upgrade or replace an older unit.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Tyson
Reviews.Content: I watch a lot of you tube tutorials and it is great having this on the big screen sitting in the comfort of your living room. Also if you are entertained by music videos, this has several great sources.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Eileen Levesque
Reviews.Content: I love this TV!  Great picture quality easy to set up!Great TV for the money I would but it again!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Land Shark
Reviews.Content: Great Picture... Apps are fantastic with quick load times.  For the money this TV can not be beat.  As always, Amazon delivery was quick and painless.

Reviews.Title: Mostly Ok
Reviews.Author: Robert Heaton
Reviews.Content: Almost a great TV. All the features works well, and the apps much faster than on the Samsung products.Only problem is that from time to time screen brightness varies intermittently. Viewing normal TV it is not noticeable - but on apps, which have a constant brightness background, it is irritating.So one has the difficult decision weather to put up with it, or go through the whole business of getting a replacement.Either way, this is a unit that should not have got through QA. In retrospect, paying $50 or $100 more would be a better deal.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Pat Choate
Reviews.Content: The TV is very easy to set-up.  The picture is superb, as advertised and verified by many buyers.  Really a great value and Vizio service is as good as Apple.  Lightening struck the house and knocked out the TV, which was in warranty.  Vizio made it good instantly.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected!
Reviews.Author: WoodWorker "Willym47"
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical after some of the negative reviews that I have read, but based on my past experience with VIZIO products I kept them in balance with what I knew. After tweaking the picture settings and turning of the ambient sensor and the some of the other sensors, I found that the picture was quite pleasing and realistic. The blackness level is really good and even in a very bright room the picture is great. I would not hesitate to recommend this TV to anyone, especially if they can take the time to adjust a few settings and not accept the factory settings. Who drives a new car where the factory last left there seat position?

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Great Picture, Slow menus
Reviews.Author: t0astm0nkey
Reviews.Content: I selected this TV over comparable Samsung and Sony televisions based on the reduced price and slimmer profile.  The picture IS wonderful, and the SmartTv functions are incredibly easy to use.  My only complaint, is that it takes 5-6 seconds for the TV to respond upon pressing the Netflix button on the remote, not a deal breaker, just kind of a nuisance, as others who use my tv will press the button a second time, thinking the TV didn't get the signal, which will cause it to cancel out of the Netflix start-up.

Reviews.Title: I'm Enjoying it.
Reviews.Author: Atom K
Reviews.Content: Great TvFor the Price can't beat it.Solid Quality, Wi/Smart tv feature was easy to learn,I have the tv talking to my router and playing movies from my external harddrive hooked to my computer.It seemed easyer for the tv to find stuff on my external.The Menu system on the search/harddrive feature is a little rough, But i think it just need to play with it more.Have a 25Ft HMDI cable coming so i can run it straight from the comp to the tv.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: J. Edgar Mihelic "Skyscraper"
Reviews.Content: For what I paid for this thing, and comparing it to other brands at the same size for twice the price, this thing is a steal.  I can watch netflix and Amazon streaming, as well as YouTube videos.  When I just want to relax and listen some music, Pandora streaming is available.The only issue is that the input for alphabetical entries is harder than necessary.  A qwerty remote is available, but it costs extra.  Otherwise, an awesome buy.

Reviews.Title: Good tv, as advertised
Reviews.Author: J. Wolken
Reviews.Content: I got this tv for my Grandpa, he likes it because it has a good picture and good sound. Quickly shipped was a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: A really nice smart TV
Reviews.Author: randy
Reviews.Content: Very easy to understand and use. The setup was very simple.  I have used a memory stick in the USB port several times to play movies, it will play the most common formats.

Reviews.Title: 24" Vizio excellent buy for $200
Reviews.Author: jarco61
Reviews.Content: First off, spend the extra $20 and get the wireless version.  Sure it isn't perfect and doesn't have the strongest signal, but it works and works well.  Great set, great picture, easy set up.  Enjoy that Amazon and Netflix have one button access (as does M-GO, but it isn't available yet).  When the "off" brands first hit the market, I stayed clear, but the quality has improved tremendously and is definitely work a closer look.I liked this so much, I bought 2!

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: Page H
Reviews.Content: I chose this television for its size.  We use it in a small bedroom that is used as a guest room and a second tv viewing room.The quality seems good and it works well.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Ernst
Reviews.Content: Nice lottle room tv, great picture and sound for agreat price. It was quite a deal. Love this tv. Yes

Reviews.Title: 32inch vizio smart tv
Reviews.Author: moto91
Reviews.Content: Decent tv for the money like the smart features plus it is an led tv  which saves on electricity ,picture quality could be better.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Spiritgirl
Reviews.Content: IThis tv works great without an antenna. The wifi setup was not difficult. For internet access it is best to connect your tv by hdmi and the internet is easily accessible. The picture is vibrant and clear, the sound is good and I am really happy about the purchase. If this vizio does well, we will certainly purchase another. Thanks much!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture
Reviews.Author: JaredL
Reviews.Content: Small things that I like:* When you mute the TV you can turn down the volume, without turning the sound back on. I know many times I'll cut the TV on in the morning or while my kid is sleeping on the couch and I mute it because it's so loud, but it's still going to be loud when I turn it down, but with this TV I don't have that problem.* The apps pop up on the side when you select them and you can size your screen to where it doesn't cut it off while you're looking for something.* The slim frame makes it seem as if it's floating in the dark, you feel like you're at the theater.Picture:The quality is extremely good with HDMI, the streaming through WI-FI, and an antenna. With sports there is a big difference in this and the 60 hz, plus it has settings to make it even better. It takes a while for it to come on (compared to other TV's) as others have said, but honestly, why is everyone in such a hurry for their TV to come on? Are you really that impatient to where you can't wait 60 secs for TV when you're probably going to watch at least 30 mins?Apps:The only ones I really use are the Netflix and Amazon. Netflix is laid out the same as my PS3 and I like that, but it does seem to buffer slower and takes a while to get a clear  picture. The Amazon app, doesn't have a place to select your watchlist (that I've found) so you have to search or dig for anything you want to watch. I'll probably use my PS3 more for Amazon, but it is convenient to not have to turn on a separate device. Youtube works good playing from the phone most of the time and I really like that feature. I'll update on other apps once I've used more, but haven't had a chance or need yet.Antenna:It was easy to set up and scan for channels and the picture quality was amazing, not to mention I get better reception with it. It actually tells you what is on local channels, how long it will be on, and gives a short description, just like cable or satellite would.Sound:This is one spot where the TV doesn't hold up well against others. The sound isn't terrible it's just not great. I will definitely invest in a sound bar as soon as I can. The speakers are on the bottom BTW. UPDATE: If you change the sound from Surround to standard it sounds much less distorted and is still plenty loud enough.Stand:I used a wall mount, but the stand seemed very solid and was very heavy so I think it would have done just fine.Remote:I like the convenience of the Netflix button and Amazon Prime button and the buttons are easy to read and it's laid out fairly well. It's small and light and points very easily. You can have it facing any where near the TV and it will work.Hook ups:The hook ups are easy to get to on the side (which is good if you want to plug something in temporarily like a phone or computer) and even though the ones that are facing downward are hard to reach it makes it where if you're mounting to the wall you can get it very flush. There are more than enough hook ups to fit just about anyone's needs.Overall, I couldn't find a TV that beat this one for the features and price and I couldn't be happier. I just hope it last longer than my Sharp did.

Reviews.Title: Does the job for a decent price.
Reviews.Author: P. Miller "Chucklehead"
Reviews.Content: Not bad. Decent picture. Easy to set up. Bought for my parents who are in their 70s and needed a good TV, but are not comfortable with complicated technology and don't care that much about the quality of the picture. That having been said- the picture is solid, and there's little to complain about so far with this TV. Some of the content provider apps are decent (Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc.), though a bit clumsy to navigate. If you really want those, Roku is a better answer, not the built-in apps. Good secondary TV for a guest room, or other use- not for your main.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommended
Reviews.Author: William H Hall Jr
Reviews.Content: I ordered this via Amazon in late afternoon on July 15.  It arrived at my door before 3pm the very next day delivered with free shipping via Amazon Prime.  Less than 24 hours, ordered and running in my home.  Amazing Amazon.  Great picture, easy setup, just as advertised.  Had to upgrade cable box for HDMI output to get HD.  Again, newly installed, but as of today, everything is great and I would recommend it.  I would also recommend buying the two sided remote fro the keyboard aspect.  ish i had paid the extra $13 bucks and ordered it, but I didn't know what kind of remote came wuith TV and I couldn't find out on internet before I ordered it.  Buy this, a deal at less than $400 for 39" Smart TV 1080p 120Hz

Reviews.Title: Works great as a monitor too!
Reviews.Author: Anton Suhy
Reviews.Content: Bought this to use as the primary extended display for my wife's 15" Mac Book Pro which is also our primary media center.Connected over HDMI and running at 1080p, this screen look brilliant! Much brighter than our old TV which was hard to see when movies had dark scenes. Can't comment much on the "smart" side of the TV as we don't currently subscribe to any of the services (living overseas at the moment) but the picture quality is excellent!For the price, this IS the best 24" TV on Amazon right now.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, size and features at a best value price
Reviews.Author: Bob Carroll : Gooplusplus•com "multi-search, ...
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: What the BLEEP ???  Why is Amazon now combining all kinds of different size and model Vizio TVs in this single review thread? This is a disservice to users. It is confusing and inefficient.===========================================================================This 29 inch Vizio TV is the perfect size for viewing when the TV is sitting just beyond the foot-of-the-bed. The slim profile and light weight makes it easy to fit into tighter spaces without sacrificing quality or comfortable viewing.The TV is capable of remarkable color and clarity. However, it did take me a while to customize the settings for optimal color and picture quality. The default setup does not reflect the picture potential that is available with careful tweaking.My personal preference (your mileage/taste may vary):Advanced Picture -> Color Enhancement -> GM/BlueAdvanced Picture -> Luma -> MediumAdvanced Picture -> Backlight Control -> OffColor Temperature -> CoolPicture Mode -> Custom-- backlight -> 41-- brightness -> 37-- contrast -> 42-- color -> 51-- tint -> -2-- sharpness -> 10The remote control (RC-29") took some getting used to. I often like to control with "feel" instead of sight. Since the RC-29" thickness is uniform and the top and bottom are both rounded, it is easy to grab the remote in the dark and not know immediately whether you are holding it from the top or bottom. In contrast, the RC from my other Vizio 16" TV is, in most respects, more ergonomic. The RC-16" was longer so buttons were more spread out and easier to locate in the dark. The RC-16" also had a smooth battery bump on the back, making it much easier to determine top and bottom in the dark. I would have just used the old RC-16" to control my 29" Vizio except that the RC-29" had channel numbers at the very bottom, making it easier to select channels by "feel" than via the RC-16".I also use a tiny $60 Android/TV box about the size of a fat harmonica that connects to one of the two Vizio HDMI ports. It gives me full internet web access (via wi-fi) and access to plenty of great apps, essentially a small Android 4.2.2 computer using the TV as a 1280x720 pixel monitor. Although this box is capable of being powered by the Vizio USB port, I prefer to use an external powered USB hub. My favorite app is the XBMC media player allowing me to easily access, via wi-fi, my notebook's USB hard drive's 1TB of movies, MP3s, and various other media files.LINK: hypercube.us/forum/index.php?topic=1202.0The Vizio E291i-A1 29 inch HDTV would be a great deal even without its wi-fi capabilities. However, why would anyone buy a non-internet capable model when any savings would amount to just a few dollars?

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Vic
Reviews.Content: Bought to replace my 7 year old 42 Vizio, this was almost half the price and a fantastic picture, you can't beat this for the price and it arrived in 2 days, ordered it on July 3rd and it was here by 10am July 5th

Reviews.Title: 39" smart tv is ruining my life! /s
Reviews.Author: RBR
Reviews.Content: This 39" smart tv is ruining my life! The picture is really great, and the netflix feature is making me stay indoors during these heat spells and watch a lot more tv than I would ever watch before. All kidding aside, the vizio is a great tv at a more than reasonable price. I have it in my smallish mancave and it is about 12' away. At this distance the picture is great and the size feels like a much bigger screen. The narrow frame means that this unit took up only a couple of inches more than the 32" tv it replaced. Setup was very easy, though there were minimal instructions on remote use. I ordered a qwerty remote to make searches on netflix easier. I would recommend this to my friends and would buy an other.Please note that the 4 stars instead of 5 is I only rate 5 for spectacular. This unit does what it is supposed to do and well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: yarid
Reviews.Content: I am grateful to them whoever make this TV. Its cheap in price but the picture quality is great like a expensive TV. It looks good, real slim. I just love this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, Crappy Sound
Reviews.Author: Honest Susan "-Susan"
Reviews.Content: No matter how I adjust the settings for the sound, the speakers suck.  My older Emerson 32" sounded way better than this thing does.But the picture is good, and the Netflix feature is really neat.Buttons on the remote are pretty tiny, kind of annoying too.Like other reviewers say, it does take a while to start up for some reason.  Can be annoying when you're just wanting to watch TV for 10 mins while you eat your cereal or whatever.

Reviews.Title: as advertized!
Reviews.Author: Cornelia A. Foster
Reviews.Content: the tv met all my expectations in terms of picture and features.  very good for price.  nice, light, streamlined and easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: WARNING!  Wi-Fi range is 30 ft!
Reviews.Author: Dynamo Dude "Dynamo Fan"
Reviews.Content: Bought this with the intent of connecting to our Wi-Fi router (why else buy a smart TV?).  TV is in master bedroom, router is in den on other side of house (~60 ft away).  TV would not read wireless signal from router (although my laptop computer and smartphones do).  Called Vizio Customer Support and was told that Wi-Fi card on TV has a 30 ft range.  Now I have to buy a Roku in order to get the "smarts" I bought this TV for in the first place.  BTW - Multiple customer reviews of Roku state that they have extensive Wi-Fi range (e.g., Roku on second floor connects to a router on first floor on the other side of house).  Not sure why this TV can't have the same range.  Considered returning the TV, but there is not a "dumb" TV on the market with comparable resolution and refresh spec's (i.e., 1080p, 120 Hz) that is cheaper than this one.  As for the TV itself, I am pleased with the picture and sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Great budget TV but flimsy optical audio connector
Reviews.Author: Rob L
Reviews.Content: I recently bought the 50-inch E500-A1 and hooked it up to a Vizio soundbar via the optical audio connector. None of the reviews I read mentioned this, but the optical port on the back of the TV is very flimsy, and it completely broke off when I tried to remove the optical port to test something out (was having trouble with the soundbar).The port was only connected to the TV with three small (like the soldered kind) connections that were probably also used to transmit data. Optical audio cables have a little wide part so you have to push until it clicks in place. When I pulled (gently) to remove it, the whole housing came out, breaking at the three connection points.I'm upset because everything else about the TV is great. I am in total agreement with the rest of the reviews. The picture quality is awesome for this price TV.

Reviews.Title: It Is OK
Reviews.Author: TSA-ORD
Reviews.Content: When we bought this during Christmas 2012, it was one of the few Smart HDTVs in the market for this size.  The price was reasonable also. One thing I don't like too much is the remote control:  it is small and the buttons are small also. The color of the TV is not as good as Samsung and Sony. It does not have a wide angle view.  If you step away from the center view area to the side, you would see a big change in viewing quality.  My 23" Samsung has a "Magic" angle which is much better than this VIZIO model.  I will give a 3 Star in quality.

Reviews.Title: Volume Glitch
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture. But I see other reviewers have the same issue as we do, the volume. I'd estimate every five or six times you turn it on, the sound is muted and the only way to correct it is to power it off, and then power it back on. Our set isn't in a main room, so the viewing hours are relatively low compared to another set we bought at the same time. And the TV with higher use is still going strong. I know it's not the biggest deal, which is one of the reasons we didn't return it, but for anyone purchasing the Vizio with plans for daily use: you may want to continue looking.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: coconutman
Reviews.Content: I wasn't looking for a smart tv when I bought this, it just had the best price tag for the size, but I have to say I really enjoy the smart aspects of it, and I don't know that you can find them at a better size and price point than on the vizio.The only bad aspects of this tv would be that the screen is not tight in the frame (it can just rock, it will not fall out) and the remote can be a little tricky to hit the sensor, but I have had it in odd positions, straight on it is fine. These are very small flaws and haven't affected it's performance at all.As for some nice points, it's very pretty, with very dark blacks and bright colors. I don't have the opportunity to use the HD ability very often, but when I do, it looks very nice, and is certainly the way to enjoy it. I game on it with no reponse time issues. It has a glossy finish, so pointing it towards a window will result in reflections, but it makes the picture prettier. The viewing angle is nearly 180 degrees, and even then it's only limited by your ability to see it, not by the screen. There are no dead pixels, which I was concerned about buying a bargain tv. The four HDMI connections, along with component, audio, optical and cable hookups make it very attractive to a device-heavy user.I love this tv and would recommend it to anyone (in fact I'm trying to convince my father-in-law right now).

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, promising features, good value
Reviews.Author: John L. Borowicz "JLB"
Reviews.Content: The overall item is great. I am a bit disappointed with the WiFi implementation which does not behave well with low-to-moderate strength signal.

Reviews.Title: Decent television for the money.
Reviews.Author: Ben Baker
Reviews.Content: For starter I only use this tv for my spare room.  This tv is great for the money and the size.  It compares nothing to my 65" Plasma Samsung, but didn't want to spend that much money on a spare tv.The tv is great for hooking up to cable, to even running internet apps like Netflix.  The sound from the tv is moderate at best.  I have external speakers that I hooked this up to for better sound.If you are a heavy gamer like me, this tv might get you by for the time being, but should not be considered for main use.  There is a noticeable difference in quality because this is only 720p.

Reviews.Title: Already failing
Reviews.Author: Kele
Reviews.Content: I'd give this 4 stars for picture quality and ease of use -- unfortunately -- after only 8 months the electronics on this unit are starting to go bad -- I'll get glitches in the picture -- generally powering off and back on will clear up -- but it gives me indications that it is probably not long for this world... very disappointed because I have enjoyed the size and features of this unit.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Rina Infantino
Reviews.Content: works great with good sound and clear picture. Perfect for the kitchen. I would buy this again in a  heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: I really enjoy this TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this TV.  It does not have all of the apps I'd like to enjoy on it such as HBOGo and SHO.  Maybe in the future the apps store will have more.  Netfilix, Amazon and HuluPlus are there along with Facebook (I can't imagine why, but I'm sure some will like this option) Twitter YouTube...a good variety are available

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: Yariel Mendez
Reviews.Content: Had the tv for months now and I love it. I definitely recommend using it with a ethernet, Wifi sometimes can be a problem

Reviews.Title: Needed a TV for bedroom
Reviews.Author: Ron S
Reviews.Content: Needed a small TV for bedroom this one is just right for a small room. Sound is fair and was easy to setup on the WiFi.

Reviews.Title: LEANS BACK JUST A LITTLE TOO FAR WHEN USING THE PROP ARM WITH IT.
Reviews.Author: troddx007 "toddx007"
Reviews.Content: We like this television. Works great and the graphics when using the PS3 or Wii are fantastic. The audio needs a bit of tuning, but overall the rating for this small tv is very high.

Reviews.Title: good comparatively inexpensive TV
Reviews.Author: Arindale Trotman
Reviews.Content: very good comparatively inexpensive TV. very pleased and would recommend it to any one who needs a fairly good inexpensive TV. could use a better control

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy
Reviews.Author: Ben J
Reviews.Content: The TV looks great, when its turned off. A black line appeared across the middle of the screen a few weeks after purchase. Buy a different brand.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Joseph Favorito
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on this TV, great picture, great sound, lots of great features. I use this in conjunction with my Google Chromecast HDMI Streaming Media Player.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at Great Price
Reviews.Author: Rodney Flickinger
Reviews.Content: Since the Human Eye can hardly tell the difference between 1080P and 720 P.  And my vision is not 20/20 as it is I decided that this 720P 29 Inch Television would do a great Job as a second television. It is working out great with out a problem. I wish I could find a Larger one to use as my Full Size Television.

Reviews.Title: great TV at great price!
Reviews.Author: Pat Mallett
Reviews.Content: The only for thing keeping this from five stars is the fact that for some reasdon , no matter how strong my WiFi signal is, I cannot get Netflix to work right, keeps losing the connection.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture
Reviews.Author: Kristine M. Cook "bass player"
Reviews.Content: When our other tv died, I quickly purchased this one because I had heard good things about Vizio.  We were not disappointed.  It's also very smart in that it keeps the tv setting for which ever mode it's in.  I watch Seinfeld every night and need the tv on a wider setting.  However, for my satellite it stays normal.  Also, going to Netflix is effortless.

Reviews.Title: Nice little TV for a bedroom
Reviews.Author: Desert Rose "Desert Rose"
Reviews.Content: I have the Vizio "smart" TV in my living room so that I can easily watch Netflix, Hula, amazon.com or youtube videos.  I have this little TV in my bedroom so I could watch Neflix, etc. in bed if I so desired.  The picture is as good as the one in the living room and both TVs share a lot of features.  The only thing I don't like about it is that the wireless in my building sometimes goes out and this TV does not have a place to hook up an ethernet cord (the "smart" model does.) So, when the wireless is not working, I find myself back in the living room watching the other TV.  Nice little TV and I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Good TV...pretty marginal Sound
Reviews.Author: R. Ross "Engineer"
Reviews.Content: We looked for a 24" TV to hang on our dining room wall to watch the evening news while eating.  It's replacing an old 19" RCA tube-style TV that's worked great for nearly 30 years, has great near-HiFi sound, BUT looked very dated in this time of flat-screens.Well, the new Vizio works great as a replacement TV of about the right size, and has good color and resolution...very happy with the picture.  BUT the sound is no where near a good as our previous 1980s TV.  With its tiny speakers, the VIZIO sounds tinny...like listening to the news through a tin can and sting.  The VISIO TV's audio controls include a frequency equalizer, and after tweaking them, I think it helped a bit, but the end result still irritates me continually when listening.  I'm now looking to replace the TV if I can find one with better sound.  We don't have room for an additional sound bar etc...we want the speakers in the TV.
