Reviews.Title: Very Pleased!
Reviews.Author: April Harrell
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV ($298) for my exercise room, planning to not have the direct TV hooked up, just using the Visio Apps (we are Amazon Prime fans) and I love it. The sound is awesome, the wireless connectivity rocks, even when my boy is playing video games on another TV. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: good tv
Reviews.Author: Edgar Esparza Lopez "ege"
Reviews.Content: this is a good tv for a room,cause is not big and its not really small so it works great,good price too...

Reviews.Title: Great value, great picture
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Tony Tiger"
Reviews.Content: This is my third Visio tv in the house and right now I wouldn't buy any other brand. The built in wireless and internet aps are really handy. I didn't even hook it up to our cable since we use it in the bedroom to stream Netflix and Amazon Prime. You can even put movies on a thumb drive and insert it into the USB port to play. I would have given it a 5 but they seem to have cheapened up the remote a bit and the directional buttons don't seem as sturdy as the remote for my 55" Visio.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: D. Murphey
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great TV for the price. The picture is great (I adjusted the settings per CNET's recommendations) and the widgets are very cool. It does take a little long to start up but that isn't a big deal.

Reviews.Title: great television
Reviews.Author: mbh
Reviews.Content: We love this TV, great picture quality.  So nice to be able to watch netflix instantly, love the "smart" TV!

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Linda J
Reviews.Content: This is my first LED and I am very happy with it. Love that I can watch HULU Plus & Netflix. Will eventually put this one in the playroom and put a larger Vizio in the living room.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Larry Everett
Reviews.Content: 720 P was better than I thought TV app are great I use netflix and amazon with 4G phone verizon

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Yen4Truth "Yen4Truth"
Reviews.Content: I love this television. The sound is great, picture wonderful. As mentioned in other reviews the quality of the remote is no where near the quality of the tv. The buttons are spongy, it is small. All round one of the worst remotes I've used-ever. Luckily, I bought a ROKU with this purchase with an outstanding remote that allows me to override this difficulty most of the time. Get the TV. It is great.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for the price!
Reviews.Author: R. Gillis
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my small home office. Surprising very nice picture for the price. A breeze to install and set up. I do not use the TV sound since I have it hooked up to my receiver and speakers. I would buy mother in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Charlene
Reviews.Content: Great price! Wifi tv is awesome!!! Remote sucks- Definitely need Qwerty remote- But- Love the TV. Great picture- Like anything- don't expect great sound from it though. That's extra! ;) But, still, I would recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: Great Clarity and Color
Reviews.Author: R. Charles Perry
Reviews.Content: I got this TV for my son, he uses it mainly to play war vidio games, and loves it. I am amazed at the clarity and true to life color.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Coloradogirl2013
Reviews.Content: I think this is a good value for a tv of this size and type.  I am using it in my workout room.  The sound is pretty blah though, so I hooked it up the some external speakers....now I can rock out during my workouts.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO 32in tv  HD
Reviews.Author: goofyone
Reviews.Content: I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS TO EVERYONE.GOOD PICTURE AND SOUND.GOOD VALUE FOR THE MONEY.CAME WELL PACKED TOOLOVE IT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: WiFi Feature a Real Plus
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Gillett
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is great but the WiFi feature allows us to stream movies and TV shows at any time in HD and as a Prime Amazon member we get lots of movies for free.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Kathleen K. Lepper
Reviews.Content: Love it!  Great deal....works very well for my 86 year old mother.  Had it up and running in about 10 minutes.  Just right size for room.  Love the "smart" options.  Made for one happy Great-Grandma to see all the great-grandkids pictures on Facebook!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: robbyrob
Reviews.Content: My daughter needed a TV for her room and we decided to get this one. She can not be happier, internet, apps, netflix, amazon prime, I mean this little guy has it all. Highly recommend for anyone who is wondering if they should get this.

Reviews.Title: Good Price and Quality for the Visio 55" SMART TV
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: So far the Visio is working great.  The setup only took a few minutes to connect the TV to the home wireless and the SMART feature works well.  I also connected the TV the to AT&T; Uverse service with HDMI and the picture is outstanding. The audio is an issue probably due to the ATT uverse but by changing a a few buttons involving the uverse remote the problem went away.  I found out about this fix by googling the problem.  The audio is not a Visio issue because when we used a DVD the TV's audio worked fine.  The ATT Uverse is also great!!Pro - all of the aboveCon - None yet

Reviews.Title: What a change up!  Very nice picture, works well for me, and looks damn good.
Reviews.Author: Frank G. Russell "Russ Russell"
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm not making a good comparison, but this television is head and shoulders better than the older Samsung that it just replaced.  Of course, the older Samsung was just an LCD, and this is an LED, and the resolution is still 720p, but the image is anything but the same.  Vivid picture and good sound.  I'm totally happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: LOVE
Reviews.Author: Chris Hessler
Reviews.Content: Literally the best bang for your buck. Not a huge fan of the remote. But I am very satisfied! Love vizio!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Quality Product
Reviews.Author: lorihicks
Reviews.Content: My first flat screen purchase and I am so pleased.  I was looking for clear picture quality and this television definitely does that.  I love the smart tv features wherein I can watch my Netflix and Hulu Plus, nothing is better than this.  If you are trying to decide between this television and a larger model that is not a smart tv, go with this one, the picture may not be as big, but you can't beat the picture quality and the features that it offers for the price.

Reviews.Title: Love my new HDTV
Reviews.Author: ki rio
Reviews.Content: The set up was so easy! I quickly could connect it to my wireless system--it was just too easy! I like to sound and the picture very much. It is much better quality than the previous HDTV I owned, which was not a VIZIO brand, but just had given out after many hours of use. This is an improvement right out of the box in picture and sound and ease of set up.

Reviews.Title: Works great with Xbox 360
Reviews.Author: M. Jagendorf
Reviews.Content: I bought this solely to hook up my Xbox 360 to, and it works perfectly fine, and was incredibly easy to set up. It has no trouble with fast-paced action games.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy
Reviews.Author: Aldric
Reviews.Content: This TV was purchased for my two teenage boys who share a room. One has XBOX and one has PS3, they both like the quality of the graphics. The wifi feature works perfect...the entertainment possibilities are endless..

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: LRB "Lemuel R Brinkley"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife after her TV went out.We already have one VIZIO set in our den.This one just as good and would buy again.I know there are better quality TV's on the marketbut for my money VIZIO is a great buy. I will saythe 120Hz are even better if you want to pay a little more.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Klp
Reviews.Content: Perfect size for my bedroom. It should come with a remote with keyboard on the back as it is a smart TV and would make set up easier

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: teddie simms
Reviews.Content: got this for my 13 year old grandson he loves it, says that the picture is much clearer than his smaller tv and has netfix,hulu plus, amazon and others already set up

Reviews.Title: WiFi isn't reliable. Consider another option
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This is a nice tv if you just want to watch regular programming.  The WiFi is not reliable as other reviews have reported.  I use other wireless devices in the same room with no trouble but consistently have issues loading amazon instant programming.  If you are looking at this for the smart tv option, consider another option.

Reviews.Title: nice tv
Reviews.Author: bmore
Reviews.Content: Seems smaller than 32 in. But it functions well  for the price. Experienced Netflix freezing the whole TV itself. Had to unplug for it to do anything. Good sound not the best but OK for price. Great picture tho. Very crisp and warm in color.vizio is definitely the best off brand company I will buy a TV from.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Lchristensen
Reviews.Content: I had been searching for a new TV for my bedroom and I compared several before deciding on the Vizio E320i-A0 I love the picture and the slim bezel it looks huge in my bedroom anything larger would have been overwhelming and I love the fact that I can Stream directly to my tv wirelessly. It did take a few minutes figuring out how to get the WiFi to talk to my modem but I love the fact if I want to watch something on Amazon or Netflix its just a button away. The picture is beautiful on this tv and I have heard some say the sound isnt that stellar but I havent noticed. I do agree the Remote could be a bit bigger but if thats the only thing that bothers me I think I can live with it. I highly recommend this Television if you are looking for a nice size TV for your bedroom or gameroom.

Reviews.Title: Vizio smart tv 32"
Reviews.Author: Frizz
Reviews.Content: Easy to work with it . I order this one to check the quality and guess what , i think to buy a bigger one!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: J.DeMille
Reviews.Content: I looked up what the best 32" TV's were online and this one came up constantly. We received  this TV a few weeks ago and so far I have really liked it! The picture and sound quality is really great. It has the cool features because it is a smart TV, but it would be even cooler if I could customize it even more with emails and my fantasy team etc. Overall a good TV for the price, I don't give it 5 stars because the remote controller is not that great and every time I turn on the TV I have to pick the input source for some reason. This could be a mistake on my part though I guess.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO SMART TV
Reviews.Author: Esther M.K.
Reviews.Content: This television is WAY better than the much more costly, option rich Samsung 5300 that I bought and returned prior to getting this one... but it doesn't hold a candle to the SONY Bravia that I'm replacing, which was an absolute joy to watch.  (Unfortunately, after only three years, the pixels on the Bravia mysteriously started blowing up).  My biggest complaint is the shiny screen, which they all seem to be installing these days.  WHY???  I have no use for these screens, and will avoid them at all cost in the future.  This TV is almost un-watchable in the morning due to the GLARE from my sky lights and reflections from other light sources."Smart TV"?  Well, it'll get you by in a pinch.  I don't care for it much.  I'm glad I've got it, (I've got bragging rights) but I very rarely use it, as I have a hard time seeing the menu.  The remote control is a complete joke.  Small, poorly thought out piece of junk.  But for under $300.00 what does one expect?!?I have no issues with the sound quality, even though others have complained.  Good thing, as I don't seem to be able to get my sound bar to work with this thing.  I like the slim, sleek design of this TV.  It takes up very little space.  For my needs, the layout, quality and number of inputs works well.  An extra USB hub would have been nice so that I could keep my keyboard (not included) plugged in at all times, but hey.  The initial set-up was easy as well.Bottom line:  Want an inexpensive "smart" TV?  This fits the bill for sure.  Do I miss the PICTURE quality of my SONY?  You bet!  Will I buy another SONY?  Probably not, but this is my second Vizio....

Reviews.Title: Vizio's are worth your time to investigate and purchase
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have two of these televisions and I love the fact that they are so easy to install.  The colors are wonderful and they are good for bedroom tvs. I love the fact that my subscriptions are easy and I don't have to worry about my kids accessing something they aren't supposed to.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: Alicia Knudson
Reviews.Content: I love this TV!  I decided to purchase a new TV to update from one I've had for about 13 years.  I was looking for a 32 inch.  I researched a bunch of them online, and decided to go with this one because it was the only smart tv in that size I found, and it was a great price.  All of the other tv's I saw only had built in wifi on larger size tv's.  It was super easy to set up with my wifi and cable. The picture looks great! And I did not need an hdmi cable.

Reviews.Title: not dissappointed
Reviews.Author: Ryan "Bones"
Reviews.Content: this tv does the trick, it is a little washed out on the color but unless your really pickey you wont even notice it. Im happy with the purchase reasonably priced and does what it states, plus I look at it this way even though I have devices (xbox,ps3) for the amazon and Netflix apps having them on the tv just means less electricity being used, and that's always a bonus.

Reviews.Title: We love this TV!
Reviews.Author: DeeTush
Reviews.Content: We had another brand first and took it back to where we bought it and then we bought this one.  Its got a great picture and we love the smart TV features.

Reviews.Title: Vizio is offering consumers an economical smart TV for a very reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Charles Sloden
Reviews.Content: Setting up wifi is tedious (typing one letter at time) but this is a very nice TV for the bedroom at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Great Smart TV!
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality! Love that I have the ability to snyc right into Netflix through the tv. Strongly recommend and quite affordable!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Richard L Myerson
Reviews.Content: Picture quality less than expected.Cheap remote control.Poor menu selection especially with the Internet apps.Amazon Prime no watch list.  Pain to find the show you want to watch!

Reviews.Title: TV works
Reviews.Author: Anybody
Reviews.Content: We use the TV for over the air signal.  I have no complaint.  The picture quality is great.  Netflix, Hulu Plus work.  Overall, it's great quality for the money.  Our other LCD LED TV is a Samsung, and frankly I can't really tell the difference in picture quality, but I can tell the difference in product pricing.

Reviews.Title: Everything Was Super Easy
Reviews.Author: Savannah Weatherill
Reviews.Content: The setup was a breeze, as far as scanning channels and setting up both Netflix and Amazon Instant Play, the TV just guides you through it, which is really nice for the not-so-tech-savvy people.Also, the Vizio is very sleek and sharp looking with a thin frame and simple base. It genuinely looks great in any room. Just be sure to re-tighten all screws after connecting the base, it might tilt to one side if the screws aren't tight.So far, the only thing I cannot figure out is how to make the picture fullscreen (meaning without the black on either the top or sides of the picture) without having to change the picture setting to "zoom" or "panoramic" (which can make the picture stretch or seem out of proportion).Overall, I am extremely satisfied with my purchase. It is the first TV I have bought and I really enjoyed that it was hassel-free.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for me
Reviews.Author: Robin Walker
Reviews.Content: I have another VIZIO TV, which was why I decided to purchase this brand. Both Vizio TV's work just fine and this on had the Wifi, which really makes things much simplier to set up.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Toni Meurlot "flygirl"
Reviews.Content: I've had my TV for about a month and really do love it. The Smart features are great and I also like the quality of the picture.Good buy on Amazon and super fast delivery. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: Love my television
Reviews.Author: Renee Tait
Reviews.Content: It was easy to get it working, and I love that it is a smart tv also the sharp color and crisp picture. Love that I can get to nextflix and hulu plus to watch my favorite shows. Did I say it has a great picture. I love my television and I got it a great price...thanks Amazon and Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Managable price and great product!
Reviews.Author: Alex Tejada
Reviews.Content: My first purchase on a smart TV after researching several brands. This Vizio is awesome baby, with a capitol "A". Again for a more advance shoppers probably will say otherwise, however for the amount of time that I watch TV is just fine. Buy one while they still last.

Reviews.Title: Great picture...apps could be more user friendly
Reviews.Author: Jerimiah
Reviews.Content: This was my first smart t.v. so I didn't really know what to expect.  But I've owned other HDTV's before and the picture on this was absolutely beautiful.  My only reason for not giving it a 5 star is I was disappointed by how slow the apps operate and the lack of options on the apps themselves.  That might be because of the way the apps were written by their respective makers.  But for instance the amazon app doesn't let you sort through the free movies you pay for through PRIME by genre.  And Hulu Plus has very limited browsing options.  You can always do searches if you know the exact show you're looking for but the operations are clunky and slow and take a while to process.  While I understand it's not a cell phone its not very much data being transmitted to have a list of movies and a few pictures.  I can put up with some load times for high data HD movies but the awkward slow apps just can make it rather frustrating.  You can spend 30 minutes just looking for something to watch on an app and that's simply a waste of time.In spite of this I'd still give the T.V. a good rating.  It plays movies brilliantly and the sound is much better than you would expect.  The sound is great for average viewing and movies.  But for blockbuster large action films or intense sports I'm going to have to get a sound bar.  It was also very easy to set up and put together in about 5-7 minutes.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Melissa Inlow
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this TV.  It works perfectly and looks great.  The remote is easy to use and you can navigate through the menu fairly easy as well.Its the best tv I've owned. This is my first smart TV, but I would recommend them.

Reviews.Title: *****Great TV for a Great Price*****
Reviews.Author: K. A. Sereduck
Reviews.Content: The biggest downfall of this Vizio Smart TV is the lack of a keyboard; but, you can plug in a USB keyboard and it works for some of the TV Apps. Also, not all video formats are supported when playing from a USB drive, and I have not been able to find a list of supported file types anywhere.All-in-all, a great buy, especially for people who use Netflix or another online video service.

Reviews.Title: I love this TV!!
Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: Amazing television, especially for the price.  Great quality picture, good sound and the extra features really expand your viewing experience especially if you subscribe to any video service.  I have only owned this for a few months but so far no problems.  I would definitely recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Oh so unhappy!!
Reviews.Author: Carmen
Reviews.Content: This was my second Vizio Smart TV.  The first was easy to set up, but this one is definitely bad.  It would connect to the internet (wired or wireless) but the Connection Test always gave a "Download Unavailable" result.  Vizio shipped me a new one but it has the same problem.  Neither one works with the ethernet cable on the current TV I have.  I'm so disappointed since the Vizio picture is so great!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in VIZIO
Reviews.Author: bayoubob
Reviews.Content: Settings didn't alter the dark and dingy picture. Defective. Returned it the very next day. I wanted to buy a domestic product, and had heard nothing but praise for Vizio. Too bad. I replaced it with a Samsung Smart TV which proved to be a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Great little TV!
Reviews.Author: Bob in Texas
Reviews.Content: We are using it in our workout room at home.  Good picture quality, especially in the brightly lit room.  The best part of this TV is the built in WIFI.  This allows us to place the TV where it was needed without having to worry about running cable.  We do not have cable or Satellite at home and watch TV through Netflix mostly.  The Vizio has a great menu of online options for video!

Reviews.Title: Broken and Vizio doesn't care
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: The coax connection for the tv is very poorly made and isn't secured to the chassis at all. It is only soldered weakly to the internal board. When I bought the tv the signal would go in and out and I thought it was due to running a long cable. Turns out the cable input was broken. When I called vizio after discovering the problem, they told me I had waited too long to call, even though the tv was still under warranty. They couldn't tell me how long was too long. Kept telling me that physical damage, even if it broken inside the box, isn't their problem. Very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: smart feature is a waste of money
Reviews.Author: C. Staniewicz "Desert Dog"
Reviews.Content: I bought my Vizio through Walmart because it was on sale, included free shipping and could be returned directly to the store if I encountered any problems.The TV itself is a good value for the money.  It's got a GREAT picture, but as many people have said, has a disappointing sound system.  This can easily be corrected by adding a sound board or hooking the set up through your current stereo system.The "Smart" TV is really a waste of money.  If you think you will have a web browser, YOU WON'T.  You must go through the apps listed on the TV.  But, there's another problem.  When using these apps, you go into a different part of the site.  For example on hulu, you can find a lot of old series that you can watch without charge through your computer.  But, when you use your app on the TV, you are prompted to join hulu and don't get access to any of the free stuff they offer.The same held true with YouTube.  When I went through my computer and put in a musician's name, over 100 videos came up to choose from.  But, when I entered the same info from the app on my TV, only 20 videos came up.This isn't the fault of the TV, I have to admit.  In a few years when technology catches up with itself, the smart feature may work better.  In the meantime, you get TONS more programming to watch by hooking this TV up to your computer instead.I need to replace another TV and I would absolutely buy a VIZIO again, but NOT with the SMART feature.  Save your money or use it more effectively by increasing the size of your screen or buying a good sound board, or even going with Roku (same problems but many more apps for less than you pay for the SMART feature.

Reviews.Title: Flawed by Design
Reviews.Author: LisaRCT
Reviews.Content: Called Vizio because TV could not connect to WiFi even though laptop, tablet and cell could connect fine. I was told I was too far away because TV must be within 15' of the Router. Fifteen feet? Really??So you must have a router in the same room or right next door otherwise you need to run a CAT5 cable. Since my router is in the living room and the TV was purchased for the bedroom the WiFi is useless.This should be clearly stated on the package as this has severely limited usability.In my mind if my other devices can connect there is no excuse for this TV not to. So, if you want a WiFi ready TV, this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: Not as smart as it should be
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV because we liked the idea of being able to connect to Hulu and Netflix without needing a separate player. Well, scratch that idea. It took 20 minutes to get Netflix to work the first time after calling tech support, and after that? Constant loading problems with every App. We know we have a good signal in the room the TV is in, so there are definitely wireless card issues with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Not as great as the reviews make it sound
Reviews.Author: Nicole Furi
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv based on the reviews here and on other sites. I am not impressed with it after a month or so. The picture is not especially clear, the sound sucks, but the worst part is that the internet connection rarely ever works. I can access Netflix on other devices ie. my laptop just fine, but nine times out of ten am not able to get it on this tv. I don't know if there is any way to improve the connection but I have not found one yet. Since I bought this tv for the "smart tv" aspects I find this very annoying.

Reviews.Title: bad wifi, no HD channels
Reviews.Author: Raymond J Visser
Reviews.Content: Bought this from another store. I am not stupid when it comes to electronics but I had to call tech support to set up.  WiFi antanne is so weak it can't pick up the router sitting next to a computer with excellent reception.  NOthing on it anyway.Picture is good on standard basic cable but doesn't recieve Comcast's higher HD channels and the picture isn't as good on the cable box. My LG did recieve HD channels without the HD box.  TV is going back

Reviews.Title: Love what I got for the price.
Reviews.Author: Kinga Brown
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an afordable smart TV so I could watch Netflix. This TV was easy to program and set to watch netflix. I love the picture quality and sound. I'm a hard of hearing person and I usually have to have my TV quite loud not because I can't hear the sound but because the quality and clearness of sound is not good enough for me to understand speech. This TV has great sound quality and now I don't have to put up volume too high to understand it. I love it and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: not what it seems to be...UPDATE.
Reviews.Author: L. JOURNELL "bULLETT"
Reviews.Content: so i  needed a new tv and was excited about getting a 'smart' one with built in wifi so i could get rid of my roku and other streaming devices...delivered quickly and set up was ridiculously simple. very light tv and basic instructions were clear and precise.but onto the three stars : this tv requires me to change the security settings on our router in order for the 'smart' aspect to work. it wont work with regular name and password like all devices in this house run on...i called them and i need to reduce the security in order to get a signal...i live in a house where i share wifi with others and certainly dont feel like asking them to lower their security just so i can stream this tv which advertises itsself as 'smart' in the first place....so the technology just isnt there yet at this certain price point...i have zero prob using my roku though so whatever....but def. important for others to know...the tv itsself is great. picture is remarkable. i use external speakers so cant say about sound. the remote was great and i feel the tv alone is certainly worth the price i paid...recommended as a tv, NOT as your only source for wifi though.UPDATE: seriously have to go down to one star for the P.O.S....the fact the wifi doesnt work was actually cool with me, but steadily the pic has been getting a white line across the top of the screen, supremely annoying...BUT last night was the end for me...during a movie the hdmi port decided it didnt want to work. just no mas para ti. had to switch it up to the other....and then the sound started cracking....i turned it off, just called AMAZON, and they are cool with returning this thing TOMMOROW.i cannot recommend this tv at all....and seriously the picture was decent but in the end...its a extremely cheap tv.....save your money and upgrade to a Samsung like i am. GOOD LUCK.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: Lisa in CT
Reviews.Content: After looking at what seems like every TV out there, I finally settled on this one. It's our first flat screen tv, so we're still getting used to the size.It was easy to set up. It's very light & easy to move. The picture is very good. It was much easier to adjust than a Samsung we originally bought & returned because it was impossible to adjust the picture to an acceptable looking one. This one was MUCH easier to adjust! It's not the best, but it is the best in my price range. For another $500 you can get an excellent picture! LOL!The remote is the only downfall. It feels cheap & flimsy. Ours broke right away & I had to buy another from amazon. I wasn't packing up the whole TV to go back to the store for a remote.I would definitely recommend this TV for the "under $1000" price range.

Reviews.Title: Good TV but came with really cheap remote.
Reviews.Author: JR
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to own my first large screen tv, this was a pretty good buy. I do notice it gets a little pexelly with some movies and some screens, but all in all I cant complain too much. Would I buy this exact tv again not sure would have to think about it and do more comparison shopping. The one thing that did turn me off right out of the box was the extremely cheap looking remote!!! I expected a much better remote considering this was a big fancy smart tv, not sure if you would consider that nit picking a little, but this is my review.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Gourniak
Reviews.Content: The tv is awesome.  It is just what I was looking for.  I love the Pandora app and learning more about the capabilities everyday.

Reviews.Title: Closed Caption missing for apps
Reviews.Author: just basic terminology
Reviews.Content: VIZIO Tvs ARE NOT compatible with Amazon video and Netflix for CC. I found out after being bounced around between Amazon and Vizio. Finally a rep. from Amazon got to the bottom of the problem and emailed me a list w/ the TVs that are compatible.The remote is also a piece of crap. I have to push an app button until my hand gets numb to access it.Customer service has limited hours and after more than an hour I did not get any solution for my problem.Will return.

Reviews.Title: Worst video compression I've ever seen in a TV set.
Reviews.Author: Ted C.
Reviews.Content: If you look closely at any image, it's mottled with bad image compression.  During footage of last February's Super bowl, the field is "moving" every few seconds even when the camera isn't, because the compression keeps re-smudging.  Also, the image is stretched slightly horizontally so everything looks wider and shorter than it should.  There's no way to make this stretching go away.  If you cycle through the different display modes it just magnifies or demagnifies the stretched image.  We returned this TV after less than 24 hours.  For major TV purchase I'm going back to Panasonic, even if boards tend to burn out and you only get a few years out of each TV.  It's worth it to have a better image.

Reviews.Content: This tv is so far ahead of the cr model I had.  Using Netflix & Amazon movies is as easy as a regular channel.

Reviews.Title: This tv is great but i woulnt buy it from amazon.
Reviews.Author: marc heys
Reviews.Content: I'll start out by saying that this tv is amazing. It has bright colors and deep blacks. I bought it because my wife and I play a lot of Xbox and we watch a lot of movies together. But you should buy it elsewhere. The first one that can,e was shipped in its own box, which UPS dented and in turn, when I pulled it out, the TV was broken. So I called amazon and the person I talked to was very courteous and arranged for me to have a new TV overnighted to me. Which was great. The next TV was dropped off while I was at work. I left s note on the door stating to put it in my shed lock the padlock and leave the shipper in my mailbox. I arrived home to a larger box on its side in the snow. They double boxed my second Tv. The outside box was wet and full of holes, and the inner TV box had a hole in it also. I feared the worst had happened and I had gotten a second broken television. So I got the box inside, opened it and imspected the TV for cracks. Thankfully there was none and so I got it set up and connected to my internet in about ten minutes. It works fine, which, given the circumstances, I got lucky.So its not Amazon's fault that UPS and FedEx messed up. But I'm giving amazon 3 stars because they should have double boxed the first TV amd I wouldn't have had to deal with the head ache.

Reviews.Title: Cheaper at Walmart!!!!

Reviews.Content: after a couple of months the display went upside down all of a sudden...the HDMI port number 2 stopped working...the tv tuner got irresponsive while scanning for analog tv channels and the menu doesnt stay on....vizio support advised to power cycle the tv which i did to no avail....replied to them that it didnt work and was wondering wether it would be main board related but no answer .....had to buy a hdmi switch to still be able to watch my security cams and sat receiver through the only hdmi port available now and had to turn my tv upside down to be able to watch it....if they dont come up with an answer i might as well rate this tv zero stars....i took the tv back home in south america and as you could understand it is not likely to be returned to the US without additional costs...before these problems it was a excellent tv at theprice but now????

Reviews.Title: Not the picture of a budget flat screen tv!
Reviews.Author: bizgoody1
Reviews.Content: I received my TV two days ago, and set it up quickly, I went from out of the box and fully connected in about 20 minutes, and even with the factory settings I could tell that I was going to be pleased with the picture quality...  Special thanks to "digitalis" whose review I read prior to my purchase, and I used the settings recommended in that review to calibrate my picture settings...  The picture quality is excellent, especially given the price point!  Most notably, the deep blacks are impressive, as is the incredible level of brightness..(My living room gets a great deal of light if all of my blinds are open, and the VIZIO E500 had no trouble keeping the picture bright enough for very comfortable viewing)I was hesitant about some of things prior reviewers had posted regarding viewing angles, but I have found that no matter where I am seated in my living room the quality looks just as good, except for extreme angles to the side the picture looks very very slightly washed out... (Honestly if you have a room so large, or so many people over to watch your television that this is an issue, you probably have the wrong size anyway... I have the 50 inch and it's perfect.All of the settings are very easy to access, and if you follow the previous recommendations for settings, you should find the quality of the picture quite pleasing.  I made minor tweaks to a couple of the settings for my own preferences as any picture quality on a television is subject to personal tastes.I previously had a 47 inch LCD from VIZIO in my living room, so I was already familiar with VIZIO internet apps, and I have always found them to work quite well, the response to opening and navigating apps is quick, and easy to connect to my wireless router.If you're not a total tv snob, and want an excellent bargain, without sacrificing quality in viewing and a 50 inch tv is the right size for you, I would have no trouble in recommending this unit!

Reviews.Title: Not a Bad TV
Reviews.Author: mfrazier
Reviews.Content: I got this for $449 the week of Black Friday. It's well worth the price that I paid for it. However, at it's current price ($648), I would probably buy the Vizio M Series for around the same price. I never bought a Vizio product before. I thought that they were junk. Overall, I'll give it a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: Blacks: A, Color A-, Sharpness: B+, Motion blur: C, Backlight and diffuser F, Sound, C+.  Needs calibration out of the box.
Reviews.Author: Kitty Purry
Reviews.Content: Picked this up from a local store, was VERY disappointed.  I'm coming from a 5 yr. old high end Samsung CCFL LCD for comparison.  The BF price was low but not worth the poor picture so I returned it.Out of the box, the calibration was way off.  Skin looked pink and green.  After some calibration, good blacks and colors vs. the old Samsung.  I wanted a new TV to get better blacks and this had it.  Turn off those horrible coloring and contrast shifting options - they change the picture consistency too much.  Colors: A-, Blacks: AThe Vizio looked slightly softer side by side - the old TV appeared to be a tiny bit sharper when pixel peeping.  Nothing too noticeable in casual viewing so not a big deal, I don't know why.  Appearance of sharpness: B+The bad: Backlight: F.  It was reasonably bright but it had some major issues: major vignetting, (dark shadows in the 4 corners) - if you go to the local big box store, you will see vignetting on some displays.  This effect can be fun on your instagram selfie, horrible on a TV.  This should be an auto F but there was more.This display also had a very inconsistent backlight.  I don't know how they make something so simple so bad.  My old TV has very consistent diffusing of the backlight and it uses old school CCFL lamps.  Backlit LED are supposed to have local dimming and no "flashlight" or clouding effect that some edge lit LED have.  It wasn't too noticeable during the day but during night, there was clearly a thin white glow at the very top, lighter vertical bands on the right side, and lighter cloudy areas on the left side.  On a black screen like credits, between commercials, or dark scenes, this was clearly visible.Motion blur: C.  Noticeable but it seems like most LCD at this price point are about the same.The base mount does not swivel but was sturdy enough.  No real problems there or with overall build quality.  It was a plastic shell-I judge on picture not the case.Sound is better than expected but not anything special, C+.  My old TV's speakers sounded like voices were coming out of a tin can.  These sounded way better but obviously not close to a soundbar.  Don't buy a flat screen expecting good sound so C is average for these.  After a few minutes I shut them off and only used the soundbar anyways.

Reviews.Author: ktk
Reviews.Content: It's a very high quality T.V. Excellent picture and a nice size. The problem with it is that the wifi card has a range of 30 feet. That means we can use none of the smart T.V. aps that we bought it for. It is disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Good tv

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price. Choose mount carefully
Reviews.Author: Roby
Reviews.Content: Good value TV.The only thing I really want to talk about is the mount. Most flat screen TVs are VESA compatible. Since this TV isnt that big, it has the same mounting holes as a computer monitor (holes in a small square pattern about 7" wide). I bought a mount that was designed for a 40"+ TV, so it was a pain to mount. I managed, but it took a little bit of finagling. If you are planning on mounting this TV, make sure you buy a mount like this:VideoSecu Articulating Motion Monitor ML12Binstead of this:B0012S4APKThe mount is the same size as the TV and you can see it sticking out of the side a little bit. not terrible, but not beautiful either.Basically, be mindful of the mount that you buy.**Edit**The sound was periodically increasing and decreasing in volume, seemingly at random intervals. I toggled the "smart sound" setting off and that fixed the problem.

Bought this TV for my bedroom, but ended up returning because of these issues.  If you're looking for a lower price TV with great picture, this is a good buy. Reviews.Content: It was really easy to set up and is easy to use :) I love how easy it is to use Netflix and Amazon and then switch back to regular t.v. I absolutely love it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV

Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. The picture is very nice, sound quality is decent. I really like that Netflix is a key on the remote, and that the TV is wi-fi enabled with the built in 802.11. Only took about 5 minutes to setup and maybe another ten to get all of the on-air digital channels loaded (about 70 in my area). I'm pretty happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Cannot get Wifi connection
Reviews.Author: K. Baker "Southernmost Shef"
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a few months now and it is about 20 feet from my modem/router. There is only a thin half wall separating it from the box, yet is does not pick up the signal. I can dit in the same area with my laptop and get a very strong signal, but the TV has one small red bar, not enough to generate a connection. I have tried calling Vizio but there does not seem to be a number for tech support. I basically, have a very fancy looking, but otherwise very ordinary, flatscreen. :(Quick update. After several very frustrating days, I finally solved this issue by unplugging the TV from the outlet. Then pressing and holding down the power button for about 30 seconds, while the TV is unplugged. On start up, after a slow start, it seemed to pick up the signal, and for the last 2 days has worked fine.

Reviews.Content: I own a 49 inch vizio that i bought last year and i have not had any problems, so i bought this one for my cabin and was not disappointed.  Great picture and easy to set up and use.  When i need another tv, i will first look at vizio, attractively priced and excellent quality, so keep up the good work vizio and dont blow it because once the quality goes down, your customers go away, sometimes for good!

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!

Reviews.Content: I love this tv!  It is a little small for a living room, but it still does the trick...Thanks to a wireless router, Hulu-plus and Netflix, I am not missing a thing. The internet apps allow me to watch most shows in clear HD. My daughter had just bought a 32" tv from Wal-Mart and stated that she wishes she had got this one instead. BTW Wal-Mart didn't have this model in stock at my store, so I looked on Amazon and got a cheaper price to boot! Yea!

Reviews.Content: Great TV.. I dont know why there are any bad reviews here.We bought this because we needed something for the baby's room for when my wife is nursing and I am trying to sleep... it keeps her awake early in the morning and late at night.  We did a lot of research and checked out a lot of TVs and settled on this one mainly because of the size for the price (not to mention we have two older and bigger Vizios).Here is what I know...1) The software works flawlessly and set-up was simple.2) The picture looks great.  I dont know about all these things people are talking about (specs on the TV)... I just know what I see.. and it looks great.  That is all I care about.The sound is great, too.  Sure, it isn't like my more expensive TVs - but it certainly does the job and is more than adequate.

Reviews.Author: Joi

The router is less than thirty feet from the tv on the other side of a half wall.  I was told by Vizio technical support the LAN mechanism that picks up wifi is not very strong in the TV.  I explanined that my lap top, and tablet pick up the signal in that room.  The technical support guy said the mechanism in the TV is not as good as the one found in tablets and lap tops.  So, if you purchase this TV, be sure the router is located close to it.

Reviews.Title: Need a narrow 32" set?
Reviews.Author: TSPORT "TSPORT"
Reviews.Content: I needed to find a flat screen TV to fit inside the doors of our existing entertainment center and still let us close the doors if need be (wife's preference). I wanted a "smart" TV to eliminate multiple remote controls laying around (Roku & TV & Digital Conveter Box, old TV was a tube job). After much research, this Vizio is the only 32" smart TV that would fit (barely). I prefer Samsung but their 32" set is about an inch wider and would not fit the space. The only 32" TV I found that is narrower is the JVC EMT32 and that is only about an eighth of an inch narrower and is not a smart TV. Dropping to a 29" set would have been too small. We have had for several weeks now. Good picture quality. The speakers sound very tinny and annoying. Played with the audio settings several times, still can not get a decent sound from them. Too little bass and too much treble. Have wired into home stereo system with the RCA jacks and can play TV audio through that if we want and it sounds much better. The 720p picture is fine for this size set. I do not feel we are compromising there. As others state, the remote is small but I don't mind the size. What I do mind is that the buttons "click" when you push them. If you are channel surfing,this gets old. No need for an audible confirmation that I pushed the button. The wireless feature was not working well for us due to router about 30 feet away on a different floor in our home. Roku box had no issue at same distance. I have since run an ethernet cable from router through walls/ceiling to the TV directly and the Netflix streaming is fine now (no different than with the Roku wirelessly). Have added a few extra channels through the app store and they are fine (Mostly use Netflix but also Crackle).  I fired Verizon pay TV and we use antenna and streaming. The free TV via antenna is broadcast in hi-def 720 and 1080 by the major stations and looks great on this set.  Summary: Crappy speakers, noisy remote and weak wireless, everything else is fine. If flawless wireless performance is important to you, you might want to pass. Smart Apps working fine with a wired connection for us.I will update the review in a few months.*** 6 month update 12-7-2013 ***Nothing much to add since the original review. Daily use since purchased. I need to get a soundbar or external speakers. The tinny built in ones are lame. One other nitpick is that I feel this TV takes too long to come on. After you turn it on, it takes about 15-20 seconds or more before you have picture and sound.  Overall, still very happy with purchase and would buy again knowing what I know now. Very good value for a 32" Smart TV (I bought it at a warehouse club for $279.95).

Reviews.Title: Defective Product Line - AVOID
Reviews.Author: Paul Bismarck
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV and originally was very satisfied.....for the first few days.  However, then the TV started to randomly dim during streaming, or got completely black when watching cable if not completely shut off.  As I began to investigate the potential issues I discovered that while Amazon still had the product in stock for shipping they halted the sale of this product because of customer complaints.  Additionally, a friend, to whom I recommended purchasing a 42" version of the same TV is experiencing the same issues (however, it was purchased from a different retailer and not Amazon).  Vizio's support was extremely unhelpful, and while yes, Amazon it sending a replacement - which means I'll just have to see if the same issues occur - I still have no answers if this line of Visio's Smart TVs is defective or if these 2 incidences are somehow a very strange coincidence.  I would recommend avoiding this brand and look at the other leading manufacturers of smart/internet-ready TVs.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Leslie
Reviews.Content: Just what we expected and just as advertised.  We love the picture and it is easy to adjust to fit individual tastes.  No complaint so far except that if you plan to do a lot of searching on the internet apps I would suggest you purchase the qwerty equipped remote.  They should just include that really...

Reviews.Title: Nice size for a tiny dorm room
Reviews.Author: Knick Kname "JSH"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter away at school.  She can watch cable TV--at least most channels without also renting a cable box, as well as Netflix, Hulu, or Amazon Prime over the LAN WiFi.  It's small and lightweight, but the screen is plenty big enough to watch in a small room.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Kathy Heimer Knight
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for my husband as a gift. He loves it the only thing he wished it had was PIP worked good in his man cave.

Reviews.Title: great price, got it originally in lieu of a ...
Reviews.Author: mohamed
Reviews.Content: great price, got it originally in lieu of a computer monitor. very light weight, decent picture. sound is OK. apps are very limited, but that seems to be a deliberate flaw in "smart" tvs overall to keep roku and apple tv in business.

Reviews.Title: clear image, clear sound, screwed up output sound jacks.
Reviews.Author: Kirk Bailey "-Fnord?"
Reviews.Content: Plugging in the stereo in the living room into the line out kills the speakers on the set in the bedroom- naturally, so does using the headphone output, but this is to be expected. other than that, it's the bomb.

Reviews.Title: Great little TV
Reviews.Author: Paul Lockyer "Headhunter"
Reviews.Content: If you're considering a small, relatively inexpensive, flat panel TV this would be a good choice.  In the past year I've purchased this one for my wife's treadmill room and a Samsung for her sewing room.  Both TV's only receive video on our wireless network.  The Samsung seems to update the bloody software almost daily.  The update usually takes a long time.  The Vizio just comes on and allows you watch Netflix or whatever other feed you choose.  The Samsung has slightly better sound and video, but the start-up is maddening.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Todd C. Young
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my mother, whose previous LCD has finally decided to go to that great electronics farm in the sky. She really likes it. The convenience of having Netflix and Youtube and the other accesses on the tv rather than through her dvd player has been a perk She said it has a great picture, is easy to use, and really likes it (even tho its 2" smaller than the previous one...ahem...)

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: J. A. Munoz
Reviews.Content: I love the quality of the picture, the quality of the light.  Sound could be better, but a sound bar fixed that.

Reviews.Title: Just bought it.
Reviews.Author: N. Feldman
Reviews.Content: So i just bought the TV today from Costco. Same price as listed her but wouldnt have to worry about shipping.The only negative I have found which i have read in other reviews is about the stand. Mine leans a little to the right which is annoying but i'll have a wall mount soon so I wont have to worry for long.I do have a question though.It says its 120hz does that mean all the time or can I switch between 60 and 120? Reviews.Title: great TV

Reviews.Content: everything with this TV is great. We are really enjoying it. Why do I have to write more when I've said all I want to?

Reviews.Title: like it

Reviews.Content: It would turn on and only stay on a few seconds then shut off. We sent it back but you were out of stock.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this TV if you want to read the Channel Menu.
Reviews.Author: Donna J. Boyer
Reviews.Content: Vizio evidently thinks the smaller the TV, the small the font for the menu should be.  Doesn't sound like a problem, but when you buy this 24 inch TV, the Channel Number is less than 1/2 an inch tall.  That's less than 2% of the screen height.  Try reading that when you are further than 3 feet from the TV.AND the description of what's on the channel is only 1/4 of an inch.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for small room
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a small bedroom. With the small bezel, it's almost all screen, and is a perfect fit for a 3-ft wide section of my wall. I considered the 24" version, but the size & cost made this the better choice.  The other factor high on my list was internet capability, and Vizio allows me to wirelessly connect to Netflix, Amazon, and Vudu, my three primary streaming channels without any additional components. Netflix is everywhere, but for those using Amazon, choices are limited, and this is a great combination of features & price. Picture is excellent, but sound is a little tinny (to be expected with its small speakers) and the network services are somewhat limited. The power cord is hidden in a self-sticking conduit, making for a neat, unobtrusive installation, using a Monoprice tilt & swivel wall mount. (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001VRIQRK/ref=oh_details_o02_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1).Very happy with this purchase and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but no HDMI Cable
Reviews.Author: Leo J. Noll
Reviews.Content: A very good TV and easy to set up and the HD tops it off. But to get true HD you will have to buy a HDMI cable. I do not understand why a manufacturer would build an HD TV and not provide the necessary HDMI cable to go with it. I recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: COMPARE
Reviews.Author: yardie man "Ja.Pepperman"
Reviews.Content: THE LG SMART SYSTEM ON MY FIFTY FIVE INCH SET IS FAR MORE USER FRIENDLY AND THE MAIN REASON I TRIED THE VIZIO WAS THAT IT HAD MORE AUDIO CONNECTIONS. I AM SOMEWHAT DISSAPPOINTED.IF I HAD BOUGHT LOCAL I WOULD HAVE RETURNED IT.WILL DO SO IN THE FUTURE

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: SR
Reviews.Content: I ordered this 32 inch Vizio TV for the bedroom. It came in less than a week, but when we set it up we saw lines and a grey spot on the screen. We promptly alerted Amazon online that we would be returning it.  They quickly were back in touch and asked if we wanted a refund or a replacement. We opted for a replacement because this was such a good price for this LED Smart TV and were willing to try again.  Amazon was very attentive through email on how sorry they were that the TV was defective. As soon as Amazon was alerted by UPS that the defective TV was shipped, they shipped out the new TV before they received it. The second one came in no time and we quickly set it up.  No problems with this second set.The color and sound are great and we are very happy with our purchase.  Unfortunately, I can not report on any of the smart features as we have yet to use them yet.

Reviews.Title: No memory in the smart TV
Reviews.Author: Laura Genin
Reviews.Content: I don't have cable, just wifi.  When i hook up my roku to the tv it works fine.  But without the memory of the Roku the movies just keep cutting out. and the only way to reconnect is to turn off the power and turn it on to get back into netflix, amazon... whatever.  So skip the smart TV.  other than that, the sound is fine, the picture is great.  good buy for the price, but don't expect much from the antenna or memory

Reviews.Title: GOOD TV

Reviews.Content: I think is ok and comfortable ,is easy to drive and is amazing , good tv ,so beautiful ,I RECOMEND

Reviews.Content: The smart TV aspects of this model are difficult to maneuver (or even get to work at all!). I would have been just fine with a 'non-smart' TV. Picture are sound are great tho.

Reviews.Author: Sandra Montes
Reviews.Content: It is exactly what I thought it would be! I watch netflix without any problems and it looks fantastic! Also the TV itself is so pretty. It's a decoration!

Reviews.Title: Best Computer Monitor
Reviews.Author: Harold L. Ryterski
Reviews.Content: The perfect size for using as a PC monitor.  Plus with internet access I can quickly switch from PC to internet and keep my PC off line. Picture quality is outstanding for viewing movies and the white for reading books and e-mail makes it easy on my eyes.

Reviews.Content: For the price, I don't think there's a better TV on the market.I expected to use the Apps on the TV more, but frankly, the interface is a bit kludgy. It's a lot easier to stream things from my Xbox 360 or Roku.

Reviews.Content: Sorely disappoint interface.  Yahoo, and only yahoo.  You will never be able to take full advantage of streaming as long as Vizio ties your apps to yahoo.  You get the big one Hulu, Netflix, MGO tv but try to find Nowhere like programing for news, or install Twonky beam, or the Smithsonian channel.  It isn't going to happen unless Vizio and yahoo get serious about serving the market.  At this point I would have been better off buying a regular HD TV and a roku device.  Oh...AND NO INTERNET BROWSER... pretty neglectful for a wireless ready TV.My solution is probably going to be to buy a roku device to upgrade this TV.  But it was cheap and has a nice picture.

Reviews.Title: Love the TV for the most part.
Reviews.Author: Chaitresh Srinivas
Reviews.Content: But controls freeze once in a while. Remote stops working. Controls on the side of TV stops working. Only way to get out of that state is to pull power cord off power source and put it back. Like I said, happens once in a while and I suspect it happens when accessing apps.And the apps interface is not that great. But I've not seen a TV that has got the apps part done well.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Sharif Sabirov "sharif"
Reviews.Content: I don't know why people insist on splitting hairs when it comes to this TV. It produces amazing image, the sound is great, and it looks very nice. For under $500 this TV is incredible. Sure the remote is a pain in the ass, apps are a bit slow but when it comes to picture quality it's superb. I think people are just spoiled and want everything to be perfect and cheap at the same time. Yeah the first TV that arrived was broken but that's life, stuff happens. I'm enjoying this TV as is out of the box without any tweaks and adjustments, it's as good as they come for the money you're paying. If you're thinking of getting it, just do it you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: 50 in tv
Reviews.Author: thomas
Reviews.Content: works good,.. as it should. was a gift ,but i  see it often .price not bad .I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: waste of extra
Reviews.Author: Q. dan "Q"
Reviews.Content: the extra thrills are not worth it, terrible user interface, terrible buffering of netflix, etc.  dont waste your time with this, its a great TV but you dont need all the extras with this Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Great value for what you get
Reviews.Author: DH Review
Reviews.Content: I got this tv to replace a TV that was way too small for the space. 42" seem to be the right size. We probably could have gone a bit larger. The picture quality for the room that we have it in is impressive. We have a west facing window that receives plenty of evening sunlight. If you are looking for deep black levels and unlimited viewing angles you will want to stick with the better performing plasma sets. I like the slim profile of the edges and it has a really thin profile.Sound quality is average. You will want to add a sound bar or something else to get higher quality sound. But for my needs It works just fine out the box. My kids usually use this tv and they are only into kids shows (Mickey and The Cat in the Hat look pretty cool on this set). My wife likes it because she can almost see it from the kitchen (like I said earlier we probably could have gone larger).Internet: The Vizio is stocked with all the basics- netflix, amazon, hulu, vudu, etc. the TV sinks well with my iPad and my kids samsung tablet.Connections: 3 hdmi is great. I would have liked 2 component connections as I still have some "old school stuff" that's still in good working condition. If you want more connections you will need to buy a receiver or some other solution...just something to think about.The price was competative considering what I paid for my plasma with all the bells and whistles and I am happy that I bought this TV. As with any purchase you almost have to wait a few months to really write a good review. Having said that I have only had mine for a month, this is my first vivio purchase after buying Panasonic which I LOVE and samsung which I like a lot. I would say this is the second best TV in my house right now...as it should be.This is probably the best rating that I can give an LED TV at this time. It's just hard to compare this TV after whatching my calibrated plasma TV for a year.I did make some adjustments to the set based on some other reviews and it seems to be affective. But as I said earlier, I am not looking for the same performance out of this tv as I expect out of my plasma.

Reviews.Content: After 2 months of research and price comparing, we decided on this smart TV...the set up was SUPER easy with the satellite and DVD/VCR.  We are very happy and can't wait to get a Netflix, Hulu or Amazon account to use the smart features.  I recommend!

Reviews.Content: What a wonderful Christmas present. This smart T.V. has an awesome picture on it. My husband commented that the picture looks better than on his LG 50" 1080p. I did have to call Vizio customer support to set up the connecting to internet part since all you get with the T.V. is a basic start up booklet. Amazon Prime has given me the ability to catch up on a few T.V. series I missed, like Parenthood's first 2 seasons.I have had the T.V. up and running about 2 weeks and I watch it everyday. I couldn't be happier and it is a perfect fit for my home office since this is a small room. I would recommend this smart T.V. to anyone. Get the HDMI cable since it really makes the picture crystal clear and the colors are very vivid

Reviews.Author: jeff
Reviews.Content: This TV has the features of my vastly more expensive Sony Bravia and the setup was just as easy.  I was able to calibrate it with the free calibration disc from AVSForums to perform almost exactly as my Sony.  I don't know what else you would want for a TV at this price.

Reviews.Title: Good price for what you get
Reviews.Author: Tasha McDevitt
Reviews.Content: Overall the TV has been a very good buy for me. It is the perfect size for what I needed it for, the smart functions are nice so I do not have to use my PS3/Wii for netflix. I do wish there was a true internet browswer. The only real flaw I have found is that occassionally the color dims for a few moments and then goes back to original brightness. It doesn't happen often, but I do notice it. Otherwise, good sound and graphics, and you can't beat the cost!

Reviews.Title: Nice T.V.
Reviews.Author: Daniel C Rossetti
Reviews.Content: I like the quality of the T.V., but I question whether the "smart" function is necessary (over just using an HDMI to connect it to a computer). The apps are limited, but great for Netflix. There's no web app available which would be very useful.All in all a great tv.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV.... but....
Reviews.Author: Skipjack2001
Reviews.Content: Okay.. bought this TV as a bedroom TV to watch Netflix and such.Out of the box, it's a nice sleek design, lightweight, and mounts on the wall well.  The remote, however, feels like a cheap toy and has this annoying loud "click" to the buttons.Setup was pretty easy... I was excited to find that my logitech wireless keyboard worked in the USB slot!  So, if anyone is struggling with keying in WiFi passwords, or having trouble typing search terms in Netflix, plug in a keyboard.  I have a small logitech that I keep on the night stand next to my bed.The picture looks great.. I used to be a videophile, but this is just a bedroom TV.. so I'm not fiddling with it too much.  The audio sounds a little thin to me... but  I may just be used to my livingroom setup with the 12" subwoofer. ;)The menus on the TV are sluggish... at best.  It takes several seconds after pushing "Netflix" for the app to open up.  Pretty annoying, really.  You would think, after having smart TV's around for so long that someone would have improved on the interface of these things.  The menus seemed laid out for a larger TV, also.. some of the fonts are hard for me to read from 10' away.  I find myself squinting a lot.I was excited to find you can stream media to this thing via a media server on your PC!  Using Universal Media Server ([...]) or something similar, you can stream videos, photos, and music to this TV! Very cool.  Again.. the interface is sluggish... and it's hard to read file names from any significant distance.  Also.. it's finicky about what video codecs it wants to play.  It'll play .avi's just fine, it seems.. but will give me a codec error on some .mp4's but not others... so, I'll have to fiddle with it more to see what works and what doesn't.Overall, I'm happy with it.  It's inexpensive, looks good on my wall, it does what I want.. albeit slowly most of the time.The remote really does suck, though.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Suzy "game gal"
Reviews.Content: We bought it for our kitchen.  The color is outstanding.  The thin design is very good for use on the kitchen cabinet.  We wanted a smart TV and this fits all our needs.

Reviews.Title: Great Television

Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality and easy to set up and connect to the internet. The built in speakers aren'r so great but 5 stars none the less. Very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Super Smart TV

Reviews.Content: we like the tv...the picture quality is great, the reception of over the air channels is very good...unfortunately the wifi connection is pretty much useless...it could not recognize our router, although it did recognize one from a neighbor (our router is less than 75 feet from the tv set and every other wireless device we own receives the signal in every room of the house)...our samsung BluRay player receives signals from our router and six other neighbors, our iPad also recognizes several other routers in the neighborhood (the houses are on half acre lots, so there is quite a bit of distance between the houses)  our iPad can receive the signal almost anywhere on our lot and iPads have notoriously weak wifi capability)we would have sent the tv back because of the wifi issue, but the price difference for non-smart sets was not enough for the hassle this would have entailed.so, three days later, we ordered a roku3...it is installed and working fine...the setup is a bit tedious, but once that pain is behind you, you'll love it

Reviews.Author: officegrl3
Reviews.Content: I love this TV! I have a 500 sq ft apartment and the size of the TV is perfect. The picture is very clear and the sound is good. If you do not plan to mount your TV this should not be an issue.Overall, it is a great product and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: The TV I perch.

Reviews.Author: JN
Reviews.Content: The first one of these I ordered disappeared, as the carrier was stupid enough to leave it at the front door on a busy street. The second one sent had a defective screen and had to be returned. Amazon messed up and did not send a replacement until I hounded them. Finally, 2 months after I originally ordered it, I got a working TV. The picture is superb, as is the sound for such a small unit and the setup was extremely easy, except good luck if you already have a Netflix account, because getting the TV to recognize that is a chore. Reviews.Author: Bradley Hart
Reviews.Content: I ordered it because it was a good price for the specifications.  Picture looked good, sound was pretty good, but right out of the box, the built-in wi-fi did not work.  It could not find any wireless networks, although they were availabe.  One of the reasons I bouth it was because it came pre-loaded with wifi and Amazon Instant Video, and we watch lots of Amazon Prime content in our family.  Spent 30 minutes on phone with Vizio tech support and tried everything.  They were friendly, but bottom line is that the TV was defective right out of the box. Hopefully it was just bad luck and not a statement about the quality.  Bottom line is that I was just dissppointed becasue it was such a good deal that didn't work out...Oh well.  I will give Amazon credit for ease and promptness on returning the tv.

Reviews.Title: Looks ok in the box

Reviews.Content: This TV looks okay in the box, but when removed and that stand is installed, it just doesn't look right. Reviews.Title: Would be perfect.. If it worked?
Reviews.Author: MuseGlance "MuseGlance"
Reviews.Content: The picture is crystal, the sound is perfect, the cable channels come in fine, but... The reason I bought this smart tv was because I wanted to access Amazon and Netflix on something larger than my laptop. The first few days I was delighted, everything worked perfectly!!Then it is like the program loop goes overloaded and it stops, tries to reload and then gives an error msg about they can't reach netflix or amazon.(yet it is easily accessed on my laptop through the same network) The only way to get it back is unplug it, hold the start button for a count of 30 sec and then turn it on and make the connection of several button efforts and then I have a 50/50 chance that it will work for...ummm maybe 15 min...if THAT!I called customer service and they just say unplug everything, but that unplugs my phone so I gave them my cell and they never called back. I suppose I just have to set aside a day for nagging tech support or call in my service contract.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: michelle cruz
Reviews.Content: The Vizio E500I-A1 I purchased this TV on the 8th of May and received the TV on the 16th the TV was returned on the 20th of May. The Vizio is a decent starter smart TV that has mediocre picture quality. At first look the TV looks like a Winner the design is great. If you want to design a room buy the vizio just dont turn it on. The sound is average and The smart Apps are okay but nothing to brag about. I purchased this TV at Dell for $599 to replace my 2yr old Sony EX700 and thought i was getting a great deal BIG MISTAKE.  The TV has a WIFI that has no on or off switch which means it will take up bandwidth in your house when the TV is on. I called Vizio and asked if there was a on off switch and the agent told me the only way i could turn off the WIFI was to reset to factory settings That was the first turn off. Next the picture clarity on the TV is average at best for a LED. The blacks are not dark and true and there is a constant blurr when watching. If i had to rate this TV on a scale of 1-10 my rating would be a 5. Bottom line if you do not want to spend alot of money on a TV the vizio is the way to go. If you are like me and you want quality, performance and durability spend the extra money and buy a Samsung or a Sony. There is an Old saying you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: You will not be able to look up anything on the Web besides the few lame apps installed.
Reviews.Author: Scott "Scott"
Reviews.Content: I am giving it one star - but I also should have been more "buyer-beware".To sum up - the apps suck.I got a similarly priced Sony for a family member 2 years ago when I didn't know anything about smart TV's.  It had full internet browsing capability through the Google app.  Anything you could look up on a computer, you could look up on the TV.  She loved it.I got this highly-rated Vizio a week ago - at the same price as the TV 2 years ago, so it should be much more functional with the passage of time - and it totally stinks.You are limited to a few lame pay-as-you-go apps - and that's it.  Netflix, Hulu-Plus, Youtube - and a bunch of Yahoo news sights and local TV stations from across the country.  Let me be clear - you cannot look stuff up on the web.Totally, utterly lame.It's going back - and I'm buying a Sony that has web browser functionality.
